commit_message:
Add ovn-monitor-all option to ovn-controller

With monitor-all option, all ovn-controllers
do not enable conditional monitoring there
by reducing the load on the Southbound ovsdb-server.

Partial-Bug: #1936781
Signed-off-by: Kamil Sambor <ksambor@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia78c0873e7ac6488b3048ae8475cc87ec40022bb

[{'created': '2020-09-03 18:26:04.000000000', 'message': "Remove async from the container build command

This change removes the async instruction and polling from the container
build command. This is being done to ensure that the command is blocking
and to ensure we're respecting return codes when / if the build process
fails. At present the async instructions mask shell failures and this is
creating hard to debug issues further in the deployment process.

Change-Id: I84592c98214490ae236ef77f0d733fc94902a9a0
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

build command. This is being done to ensure that the command is blocking
and to ensure we're respecting return codes when / if the build process
fails. At present the async instructions mask shell failures and this is

Closes-Bug: 1894067

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove async from the container build command

This change removes the async instruction and polling from the container
build command. This is being done to ensure that the command is blocking
and to ensure we're respecting return codes when / if the build process
fails. At present the async instructions mask shell failures and this is
creating hard to debug issues further in the deployment process.

Closes-Bug: 1894067
Change-Id: I84592c98214490ae236ef77f0d733fc94902a9a0
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enable Ansible fact cache

Without a fact cache for Ansible, using --start-at-task
doesn't work since it doesn't have the required Ansible
facts for the deployment to proceed. This change enables
the Ansible Fact Cache plugin and caches facts in the
workdir for the Playbook execution.

Closes-Bug: #1937140
Change-Id: Id4ef377c93e6439407ea4aba7f124dc73d0b8410

commit_message:
Update db backup/restore retry for sending to remote

There is an additional error status 'Service Unavailable' which can
indicate the service is temporary unavailable. Adding that error
status to the retry list in case the issue is resolved during the
backup timeframe.

Change-Id: I9e2fc1a9b33dea3858de06b10d512da98a635015

Adding a reference query

The reference query should always return some hits. So we can make sure the dashboard is working.

Change-Id: Id297ea3baa29e239985229fb8811f130e3b84860

subject: Add ability to exclude variables from kolla-ansibles globals.yml
messages:
[{'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-06-19 12:19:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-06-19 12:21:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Thought I'd get some feedback on whether or not this was a good way to solve the issue, before I spent any more time. The idea is that you would guard every variable in globals.yml.j2 in a similar way."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-06-19 14:31:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It feels a little clunky to have to do this for every variable. There is a way around it without code changes:

globals.yml:
global_var: "{{ group_var }}"

group_vars/1:
group_var: foo

group_vars/2:
group_var: bar

Also a little clunky. I expect we might have to do this more often with multiple environment support though. Another option is we could grab merge_yaml from kolla-ansible, and extend it to ignore a set of keys.'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2020-06-19 14:48:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> It feels a little clunky to have to do this for every variable.

 > group_vars/2:
 > group_var: bar

 > Also a little clunky. I expect we might have to do this more often
 > with multiple environment support though. Another option is we
 > could grab merge_yaml from kolla-ansible, and extend it to ignore a
 > set of keys.

hmm, thanks for the comments. Not sure I see how your example works. Isn't globals.yml templated by localhost? So, why would the group_vars from another group be applied to the templating? . Maybe I missed something. Using merge yamls sounds promising though.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-06-19 15:52:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Add ability to exclude variables from kolla-ansibles globals.yml

Sometimes it useful to override the kayobe global defaults to per-host or
per-group settings.

Change-Id: I3865993e773dca73533f06002efcee14e623c67b
Story: 2007834
Task: 40121

subject: Removing of unused nova services after upgrade
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-03 16:15:32.000000000', 'message': 'Removing of unused nova services after upgrade

In OpenStack Train there is not used nova-consoleauth
service anymore. So this patchset adds removing of it
after upgrade to Train.

Also after this upgrade nova-scheduler is duplicated
in OpenStack services output. It is caused by connecting new
nova-scheduler service to different DB. So this new service
is stored on different place and nova-scheduler service
is visible in DB twice.
This change removes old entries of nova-scheduler after upgrade.

Closes-Bug: #1863107
Signed-off-by: o.horecny2 <o.horecny2@partner.samsung.com>
Change-Id: Ibe7c06995852e478305942cadceea8f28adbdc93

commit_message:
Removing of unused nova services after upgrade

In OpenStack Train there is not used nova-consoleauth
service anymore. So this patchset adds removing of it
after upgrade to Train.

Also after this upgrade nova-scheduler is duplicated
in OpenStack services output. It is caused by connecting new
nova-scheduler service to different DB. So this new service
is stored on different place and nova-scheduler service
is visible in DB twice.
This change removes old entries of nova-scheduler after upgrade.

Closes-Bug: #1863107
Signed-off-by: o.horecny2 <o.horecny2@partner.samsung.com>
Change-Id: Ibe7c06995852e478305942cadceea8f28adbdc93

commit_message:
Revert "Combine new modules into a single package"

This reverts commit 0ecc6e0bbbb0ca788e6924fcfb4925d6d30a108a.

Reason for revert: Broken requirements for rpm packaging. Unit tests
require ansible but is not capture in the rpm specs. Also, that is a 
problem just like adding cliff to the requirements as ansible
is not available by default.

Change-Id: I42ae05e4a674dfae544cfd8113ced5c41207740b

commit_message:
Don't generate 10-neutron_wsgi.conf with internal tls

When internal TLS is enabled we use a proxy in front of
neutron server. Config generated in change
I302558e718ce35c4d632137c5efa08f502939b40 conflicts with
the one generated for tls_proxy. Till we convert neutron_api
to be deployed with httpd, let's generate the wsgi config
only when enable_internal_tls is false.

Closes-Bug: #1936776
Change-Id: I2901ea548332a043a8ffeb268f3a0ccbca265377

commit_message:
Pin tenacity and psycopg2 for py35/xenial

The libraries:

 * tenacity >= 8.0.0
 * psycopg2 >= 2.9.0
 * requests >= 2.26.0

dropped py35 support, thus breaking on Xenial.  This pins those
libraries.

Change-Id: Ie565747b28d0e21c83725837516b04db641de4a5
Closes-Bug: #1934107

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-21 21:13:48.000000000', 'message': 'Trim line breaks from pacemaker bundle function

On CentOS9, the cibadmin query is returning '\n' if the bundle is not
defined which results in:

Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, invalid
value for Integer(): "\n" (line: 1, column: 1) on node
standalone-0.localdomain

This change strips whitespace from the check to ensure it has a value
before we attempt to convert to an integer.

Change-Id: I369644d491357a8cdeae3eff51f4f595b1033b66
(cherry picked from commit 256d677dc74a96a2004213189730e6e0b9bbd195)
'}]
commit_message:
Trim line breaks from pacemaker bundle function

On CentOS9, the cibadmin query is returning '\n' if the bundle is not
defined which results in:

Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, invalid
value for Integer(): "\n" (line: 1, column: 1) on node
standalone-0.localdomain

This change strips whitespace from the check to ensure it has a value
before we attempt to convert to an integer.

Change-Id: I369644d491357a8cdeae3eff51f4f595b1033b66
(cherry picked from commit 256d677dc74a96a2004213189730e6e0b9bbd195)

commit_message:
[WIP][ffwd] Symlink /boot/grub2/grubenv /boot/efi/EFI/redhat/grubenv

Last option to make efi work on most systems is to
by default symlink the two grubenv files. This means
that some older RHEL8 grub will fail to boot.

Change-Id: I5f3556842f33d5a7ce1f384b7cab698ea7d0aaee

While shibboleth and mod_auth_openidc can theoretically co installed
now, unfortunately the shibboleth enabled configuation will cause
issues when using mod_auth_openidc.
As we only drop the configuration for one of these apache mods at a time
I have decided that it is best we only support one of these packages
being present at any time to avoid conflicts.

Change-Id: Ib0ebf1711db42dd00b3e14c1e5604fed2632437d
(cherry picked from commit a57255b9fc9e30327d73b5fd502c2037f9c212dc)
'}]
commit_message:
Improvements to federation packaging

While shibboleth and mod_auth_openidc can theoretically co installed
now, unfortunately the shibboleth enabled configuation will cause
issues when using mod_auth_openidc.
As we only drop the configuration for one of these apache mods at a time
I have decided that it is best we only support one of these packages
being present at any time to avoid conflicts.

Change-Id: Ib0ebf1711db42dd00b3e14c1e5604fed2632437d
(cherry picked from commit a57255b9fc9e30327d73b5fd502c2037f9c212dc)

[{'created': '2021-05-21 21:02:58.000000000', 'message': 'Force sync before checking clock status

We are seeing occasional failures of the test_ntp_clock_synchronized
test in the kayobe-overcloud-host-configure-ubuntu-focal job:

______________________ test_ntp_clock_synchronized[local] ______________________
host = <testinfra.host.Host local>
    def test_ntp_clock_synchronized(host):
        # Tests that the clock is synchronized
        status_output = host.check_output("timedatectl status")
>       assert "synchronized: yes" in status_output
E       AssertionError: assert 'synchronized: yes' in '               Local time: Fri 2021-05-21 06:41:41 HST  \n           Universal time: Fri 2021-05-21 16:41:41 UTC  \n ...  \n              NTP service: active                       \n          RTC in local TZ: no                           '
src/opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/playbooks/kayobe-overcloud-host-configure-base/tests/test_overcloud_host_configure.py:171: AssertionError

Forcing a clock sync before checking clock status should prevent this
issue.

Change-Id: Iaba35f237c75392586a4d86baef9bc7836c3fe1b
'}]
commit_message:
Force sync before checking clock status

We are seeing occasional failures of the test_ntp_clock_synchronized
test in the kayobe-overcloud-host-configure-ubuntu-focal job:

______________________ test_ntp_clock_synchronized[local] ______________________
host = <testinfra.host.Host local>
    def test_ntp_clock_synchronized(host):
        # Tests that the clock is synchronized
        status_output = host.check_output("timedatectl status")
>       assert "synchronized: yes" in status_output
E       AssertionError: assert 'synchronized: yes' in '               Local time: Fri 2021-05-21 06:41:41 HST  \n           Universal time: Fri 2021-05-21 16:41:41 UTC  \n ...  \n              NTP service: active                       \n          RTC in local TZ: no                           '
src/opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/playbooks/kayobe-overcloud-host-configure-base/tests/test_overcloud_host_configure.py:171: AssertionError

Forcing a clock sync before checking clock status should prevent this
issue.

Change-Id: Iaba35f237c75392586a4d86baef9bc7836c3fe1b

'}, {'created': '2019-02-01 00:08:00.000000000', 'message': '[DNM] Demonstrate the use of Mitogen with OSA

This is the most minimal change which should enable the AIO build
to use Mitogen. Multinode builds will not work. This relies on a
patched version of Mitogen.

This change also adds the "mitogen_via" parameter to the stock
inventory from within the container host name group variables.
This will allow mitogen to connect to containers using the
physical host as a bastion without taking away our ability
to add more remotes via overrides or group_vars.

Change-Id: I023e9ebf99d27332ed0083319d27ae4019bddccb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-02-01 00:23:10.000000000', 'message': '[DNM] Demonstrate the use of Mitogen with OSA

This is the most minimal change which should enable the AIO build
to use Mitogen. Multinode builds will not work. This relies on a
patched version of Mitogen.

This change also adds the "mitogen_via" parameter to the stock
inventory from within the container host name group variables.
This will allow mitogen to connect to containers using the
physical host as a bastion without taking away our ability
to add more remotes via overrides or group_vars.

Change-Id: I023e9ebf99d27332ed0083319d27ae4019bddccb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
[WIP] Use the Mitogen connection method in OSA

This is the most minimal change which should enable us to use
Mitogen by adding the "mitogen_via" parameter to the stock
inventory from within the container host name group variables
and setting the `ansible_host` key to the expected inventory
hostname when executing against a container. This will allow
mitogen to connect to containers using the physical host as a
bastion which will allow deployers the ability to setup
additional gateways using secondary, overlay, inventories as
needed.

Mitogen Issue: https://github.com/dw/mitogen/issues/510
> Role requirements for mitogen is using an issue branch which enables
  the inventory to address container specific entities with the new
  `mitogen_container_name` key.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/717728
Change-Id: I023e9ebf99d27332ed0083319d27ae4019bddccb
Co-authored-by: Jonathan Rosser <jonathan.rosser@rd.bbc.co.uk>
Co-authored-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
Signed-off-by: cloudnull <kevin@cloudnull.com>

Tried a mixed pxe/ipxe setup locally, and remembered why it won't work in kolla:

2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils Traceback (most recent call last):
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils   File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/ironic/conductor/deployments.py", line 169, in do_node_deploy
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils     task.driver.deploy.prepare(task)
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils   File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/ironic_lib/metrics.py", line 59, in wrapped
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils     result = f(*args, **kwargs)
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils   File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/ironic/conductor/task_manager.py", line 148, in wrapper
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils     return f(*args, **kwargs)
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils   File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/ironic/drivers/modules/agent.py", line 644, in prepare
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils     task.driver.boot.prepare_ramdisk(task, deploy_opts)
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils   File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/ironic_lib/metrics.py", line 59, in wrapped
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils     result = f(*args, **kwargs)
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils   File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/ironic/drivers/modules/pxe_base.py", line 212, in prepare_ramdisk
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils     ipxe_enabled=self.ipxe_enabled)
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils   File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/ironic/common/pxe_utils.py", line 1239, in cache_ramdisk_kernel
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils     CONF.force_raw_images)
21-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils   File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/ironic/drivers/modules/deploy_utils.py", line 240, in fetch_images
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils     cache.fetch_image(href, path, ctx=ctx, force_raw=force_raw)
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils   File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/ironic/drivers/modules/image_cache.py", line 127, in fetch_image
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils     os.link(master_path, dest_path)
2021-07-20 10:03:22.363 8 ERROR ironic.conductor.utils OSError: [Errno 18] Invalid cross-device link: '/tftpboot/master_images/d8edd71b-1ac0-474e-821e-cf6b119ac387.converted' -> '/httpboot/4b48ac84-ea8d-4a1e-bdab-09f6a170a284/deploy_kernel'

The TFTP image cache is shared by pxe and ipxe drivers, and is located at /tftpboot/master_images by default. It fails creating a symlink to /httpboot under ipxe driver, since these are on separate devices (Docker volume bind mounts). That is why the default TFTP master path config is overridden when iPXE is enabled.

Probably the best approach is to always enable the HTTP server, but keep the PXE/iPXE flag.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-20 11:40:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-20 14:24:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-21 09:03:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-07-21 16:12:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-19 09:11:14.000000000', 'message': 'ironic: Enable iPXE booting by default

In the Xena release, Ironic removed the iSCSI driver [1]. The
recommended driver is direct, which uses HTTP to transfer the disk
image. This requires an HTTP server, and the simplest option is to use
the one deployed when enable_ironic_ipxe is set to true. For this
reason, this patch sets enable_ironic_ipxe to true by default. Ironic
users should note that it is necessary to enable the ipxe boot interface
via [DEFAULT] enabled_boot_interfaces in order to use iPXE booting.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/789382

Change-Id: I30c2ad2bf2957ac544942aefae8898cdc8a61ec6
'}, {'created': '2021-07-19 10:58:50.000000000', 'message': 'ironic: Enable iPXE booting by default

In the Xena release, Ironic removed the iSCSI driver [1]. The
recommended driver is direct, which uses HTTP to transfer the disk
image. This requires an HTTP server, and the simplest option is to use
the one deployed when enable_ironic_ipxe is set to true. For this
reason, this patch sets enable_ironic_ipxe to true by default. Ironic
users should note that it is necessary to enable the ipxe boot interface
via [DEFAULT] enabled_boot_interfaces in order to use iPXE booting.

Also copy across IPA kernel & ramdisk images to the PXE (TFTP)
container, even when iPXE is enabled. This allows for a mixed PXE/iPXE
setup.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/789382

Change-Id: I30c2ad2bf2957ac544942aefae8898cdc8a61ec6
'}, {'created': '2021-07-20 11:40:01.000000000', 'message': 'ironic: always enable conductor HTTP server

commit_message:
ironic: always enable conductor HTTP server

In the Xena release, Ironic removed the iSCSI driver [1]. The
recommended driver is direct, which uses HTTP to transfer the disk
image. This requires an HTTP server, and the simplest option is to use
the one currently deployed when enable_ironic_ipxe is set to true. For
this reason, this patch always enables the HTTP server running on the
conductor.

iPXE is still enabled separately, since it cannot currently be used at
the same time as PXE.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/789382

Change-Id: I30c2ad2bf2957ac544942aefae8898cdc8a61ec6

[{'created': '2021-07-21 09:03:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ironic_ipxe healthcheck on Debian/Ubuntu

The healthcheck checks for a process called httpd, but these distros
call it apache2.  This results in the ironic_ipxe container being marked
as unhealthy.

This change fixes the issue by making the process name distro dependent.

Change-Id: I0b0126e3071146e7f8593ba970ecbed65b36fcfa
Closes-Bug: #1937037
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ironic_ipxe healthcheck on Debian/Ubuntu

The healthcheck checks for a process called httpd, but these distros
call it apache2.  This results in the ironic_ipxe container being marked
as unhealthy.

This change fixes the issue by making the process name distro dependent.

Change-Id: I0b0126e3071146e7f8593ba970ecbed65b36fcfa
Closes-Bug: #1937037

messages:
[{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-09 10:32:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-09 12:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Here is the output: https://d85800e2e6de8bf05484-70b013fe9ea05f673313d916271f541a.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/795512/1/check/kolla-ansible-centos8s-source/b38e215/primary/logs/kolla/fluentd/fluentd-tsv-logger.txt

Currently we are only getting logs from fluentd, rabbitmq and mariadb.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-09 12:31:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-09 12:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Trying again, now matching against ** rather than *.**'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2021-06-09 12:38:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I predict you will get a similar result until you pull in this :) https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/795086'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-09 12:47:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> I predict you will get a similar result until you pull in this :) https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/795086

Strangely I did get other logs when testing locally.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-09 12:48:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2:
> > 
> > I predict you will get a similar result until you pull in this :) https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/795086
> 
> Strangely I did get other logs when testing locally.

I was doing some restarts though. I think you're right, but would like to check before depending on that one."}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2021-06-09 13:19:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I've also seen other logs (including OpenStack python logs) arrive in Elastic (but only a subset of logs). I haven't looked carefully about how the tail input plugin works, but perhaps there are some leads with the inotify settings: https://docs.fluentd.org/input/tail#enable_watch_timer"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-09 13:30:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> I've also seen other logs (including OpenStack python logs) arrive in Elastic (but only a subset of logs). I haven't looked carefully about how the tail input plugin works, but perhaps there are some leads with the inotify settings: https://docs.fluentd.org/input/tail#enable_watch_timer

There was recently a patch proposed to enable it, but with no explanation. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla-ansible/+/785309"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-09 13:35:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-09 13:36:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Confirmed, no change with ** match. Trying old fluentd'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2021-06-09 15:27:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Lots of logs now..

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/0b59fcdc903741d9a8e40044a2159c42/log/primary/logs/kolla/fluentd/fluentd-tsv-logger.txt'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-09 18:56:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Where to go from here?

* decide which keys are interesting
* basic validation of each event within the script (all expected fields, correct hostname, etc.)
* aggregate based on one or more values (e.g. programname)
  * could be as simple as touch a file named $programname?
* at the end of the run, verify that all expected entries exist (nova-compute, keystone, etc.). [scenario-specific]'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-09 18:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Set Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-11 20:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-11 21:25:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-14 09:56:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-14 11:34:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-14 12:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-14 13:48:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-15 09:45:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-15 11:03:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-15 11:38:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-15 13:23:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-16 15:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-16 17:12:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-16 18:50:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-06-17 07:36:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17: Patch Set 16 was rebased.'}]

subject: Add a keylime-agent element and a tpm-emulator element
messages:
[{'account_id': 32617, 'date': '2021-05-04 16:20:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32617, 'date': '2021-05-04 18:09:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 32617, 'date': '2021-05-04 20:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 32617, 'date': '2021-05-04 21:37:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 32617, 'date': '2021-05-06 15:32:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-05-10 00:19:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

I guess the main question is if this belongs in DIB or Ironic?  If it doesn't need anything special from dib and is fairly specific to an Ironic deployment situation, it's probably better to keep this as a separate element with people who understand it reviewing it."}, {'account_id': 32617, 'date': '2021-05-10 20:40:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 5:
> 
> I guess the main question is if this belongs in DIB or Ironic?  If it doesn't need anything special from dib and is fairly specific to an Ironic deployment situation, it's probably better to keep this as a separate element with people who understand it reviewing it.

Yes, this element is specific to Ironic deployment. I proposed this change to ironic-python-agent before and reviewers suggested me to propose it to this repo."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-05-11 07:12:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Yes, this element is specific to Ironic deployment. I proposed this change to ironic-python-agent before and reviewers suggested me to propose it to this repo.

I don't want to send you into an endless loop ... but does this really make sense in DIB?  I'm not sure the people who know anything about this review here, if you want fixes released it will be stuck with all the other things on the dib master branch, it's not getting testing here, etc.

If people involved are telling me they really want it in here, then OK, but I think it's something to consider carefully..."}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2021-05-14 09:45:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I agree with Ian. Perhaps it would be worth to get insights from the Ironic team to why they think having this new element in DIB would be best than in Ironic. I'd say, having experience with DIB and Octavia where we have our own DIB elements in our repository, that if there's a bug in keylime-agent you not only need to fix it and hunt DIB cores for reviews, but also request a DIB release *and* bump the DIB version constraint in Ironic since DIB is branchless. Bumping version constraints on branched versions (e.g. stable/wallaby Ironic) is somewhat a hard call to make and has repercussions to packagers/distros. Just some food for thought."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-05-17 18:08:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(14 comments)

So personally I think it makes a lot of sense in DIB, of course with some changes and not the emulator being installed as-is.

The use case for this element extends beyond baremetal, but into general secure computing of ensuring that a workload has not been tampered by using a TPM module or vTPM to measure the running system and attest it's state to a remote attestation system. This allows an infrastructure operator to identify if the underlying running OS, or even firmware has been tampered with by an attacker who has gained system access.  In a bare metal use case, it is vital to be able to identify these sorts of things at least at the hardware level, although not as much of the running deployment/cleaning ramdisk (with the exception of firmware). In any deployed workload, where a machine may be living for days, weeks, months, or even years, being able to have the agent burned in and be able to be leveraged becomes a powerful asset to ensure continued un-tampered operation of a running system, be it virtual or physical.

So I hope that at least paints the overall picture, as at least I see it. From a standpoint of association with ironic, ironic is just a springboard to help validate the system has not been modified between operating tenants in the Mass Open Cloud (and others who are similarly interested in the same checks and mechanisms in the larger community), so it being available to ironic in general is a good value-add for them to be able to identify those changes and halt deployment or cleaning processes. Ultimately all optional and not explicitly required, and this can be used without ironic at all.

Mechanics wise, when we look at how ironic would interact if an element is selected into a deployment ramdisk, is ironic should ultimately attempt to ensure that attestation has taken place and then go ask the registrar directly unrelated to the dib element, if the attestation passed or failed. Again optional, not required, and loosely coupled to achieve a larger task.

For a deployed workload, the element would be used in the image. The baremetal node or VM with vTPM would be deployed, and from there the software would independently operate without knowing anything of or about ironic while achieving it's larger mission at hand.

IMHO, that latter item seems to bring the most value to the community at large which really causes me to think this is the right place for such an element."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-05-17 18:12:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 32617, 'date': '2021-05-17 20:30:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(15 comments)'}, {'account_id': 32617, 'date': '2021-06-10 22:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 32617, 'date': '2021-06-11 13:40:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 32617, 'date': '2021-06-14 17:06:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 32617, 'date': '2021-07-06 13:44:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 32617, 'date': '2021-07-20 14:06:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-07-22 06:13:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

we've had the discussion and it seems people want this in dib so OK.  If no further comments I'll merge this."}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2021-07-22 09:24:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

'}, {'created': '2020-01-22 10:43:44.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Improve resiliency of collection

- assure molecule report is fully colored on CI (notty)
- avoid warnings related to python interpreter detection
- avoid runtime warnings from ansible due to use of shell
- avoid displaying collection tasks as failed in console
- parallelize info collecting scripts
- now molecule job also produces a collected_logs inside tox folder,
  making easier to see what was collected during functional testing.

How to test the default scenario:
`molecule converge` or `tox -e molecule -- -k default`

Compare before/after this change:
- total duration
- number of runtime warnings from ansible going down
- number of tasks with errors
- number of collected files (should be lower as we now combine the
  small ones into report.json manifest file.

Change-Id: I08b2cf830104f6da1d2a83391ff7d9e864cb845f

- avoid displaying collection tasks as failed in console
- parallelize info collecting scripts
- now molecule job also produces a collected_logs inside tox folder,
  making easier to see what was collected during functional testing.

How to test the default scenario:
`molecule converge` or `tox -e molecule -- -k default`

Compare before/after this change:
- total duration
- number of runtime warnings from ansible going down
- number of tasks with errors
- number of collected files (should be lower as we now combine the
  small ones into report.json manifest file.

Change-Id: I08b2cf830104f6da1d2a83391ff7d9e864cb845f

'}, {'created': '2020-02-01 11:30:00.000000000', 'message': 'POC: Parallelize collection commands

* parallelize info collecting scripts
* avoid displaying collection tasks as failed in console
* now molecule job also produces a collected_logs inside tox folder,
  making easier to see what was collected during functional testing.
* Collected command output is now in host-root log directory instead
  of under var/log/extra, so you can reach them faster.

* _artcl_.txt file contains collection summary (underline added to
  assure is listed before the others).

How to test the default scenario:
`molecule converge` or `tox -e molecule -- -k default`

Checklist for evaluating this change (before/after):
- total duration
- number of runtime warnings from ansible
- number of tasks with errors
- number of collected files

Change-Id: I08b2cf830104f6da1d2a83391ff7d9e864cb845f

commit_message:
DNM: POC to parallelize collection commands

* parallelize info collecting scripts

Checklist for evaluating this change (before/after):
- total duration
- number of runtime warnings from ansible
- number of tasks with errors
- number of collected files

Change-Id: I08b2cf830104f6da1d2a83391ff7d9e864cb845f

commit_message:
gnocchi: add python3-rados to gnocchi-base source image

The binary images include python3-rados as a dependency, but source
images do not. This change fixes that.

Change-Id: I2c8cdfcd25856ecdcfd9f302965187b3b62376ad
Closes-Bug: #1927756
(cherry picked from commit c29f818696c74fd32b929a763695d244e112a33c)

commit_message:
gnocchi: add python3-rados to gnocchi-base source image

The binary images include python3-rados as a dependency, but source
images do not. This change fixes that.

Change-Id: I2c8cdfcd25856ecdcfd9f302965187b3b62376ad
Closes-Bug: #1927756
(cherry picked from commit c29f818696c74fd32b929a763695d244e112a33c)

messages:
[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-07-09 13:39:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-07-09 15:30:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Would like the Block Storage API v2 support removed before release.  Patches are:
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-cinderclient/+/791834
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-cinderclient/+/792959'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-07-15 20:44:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

A further blocker is that Horizon is currently using some cinderclient.v2 classes, so this patch needs to merge before ones mentioned in the previous comment:

LGTM:

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-09 13:39:00.000000000', 'message': 'Xena-2 Release for python-cinderclient

This is the Xena milestone-2 release for python-cinderclient.
Clients and libraries following the cycle-with-intermediary release
model are encouraged to release each milestone to make sure updates
are made available.

If you are happy with the current release hash, please +1 this patch
and we will process a release. If you need to get some important
changes merged first, leave a -1 and update the patch with a new
commit hash to use once it is ready.

If a release is definitely not wanted at this time, please -1 and
leave a comment explaining that and we can abandon the patch.

Any patches with no response will be assumed to be OK and will be
processed by July 15.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 7.4.0..b891c99
b891c99 Remove skip_missing_interpreters
f54b873 Run functional job on Ubuntu Focal
8d8d457 setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores
202c1a3 Add Python3 xena unit tests
a0e3621 Update master for stable/wallaby
9c2e8df Support passing client certificates for server version requests

Signed-off-by: Herv칠 Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I9086dc5a86969dad6110ba837aba49df7444e058
'}, {'created': '2021-07-20 17:14:58.000000000', 'message': 'Xena-2 Release for python-cinderclient

This is the Xena milestone-2 release for python-cinderclient,
released as version 8.0.0.  It removes support for the Block
Storage API version 2, which was deprecated in Pike by change
I913c44799cdd.

Removing v2 support from the cinderclient was discussed on the
openstack-discuss mailing list:

commit_message:
Xena-2 Release for python-cinderclient

This is the Xena milestone-2 release for python-cinderclient,
released as version 8.0.0.  It removes support for the Block
Storage API version 2, which was deprecated in Pike by change
I913c44799cdd.

Removing v2 support from the cinderclient was discussed on the
openstack-discuss mailing list:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-November/018876.html

Signed-off-by: Herv칠 Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I9086dc5a86969dad6110ba837aba49df7444e058

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-05 15:14:39.000000000', 'message': 'Remove wrong command in "ceph in kolla" guide.

To use feature of external journal drive , install guide inform
to create a partition with parted as below.

parted /dev/sdb -s -- mklabel gpt
mkpart KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_J 0 5GB
parted /dev/sdb -s -- mklabel gpt
mkpart KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D 5GB 100%

Our prediction is that two partitions are created,
but in reality only one partition is created as below.

Number Start End Size File system Name Flags
 1 5000MB 107GB 102GB KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D

Because KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_J was override
by KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D.

To create two partitions, we need to remove mklabel gpt
in second command to create patition.

Closes-Bug: #1702500

Change-Id: Ic4e9da5d8c24c666319e728e38e55f23305c2134
Signed-off-by: jangseon ryu <jangseon.ryu@navercorp.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove wrong command in "ceph in kolla" guide.

To use feature of external journal drive , install guide inform
to create a partition with parted as below.

parted /dev/sdb -s -- mklabel gpt
mkpart KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_J 0 5GB
parted /dev/sdb -s -- mklabel gpt
mkpart KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D 5GB 100%

Our prediction is that two partitions are created,
but in reality only one partition is created as below.

Number Start End Size File system Name Flags
 1 5000MB 107GB 102GB KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D

Because KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_J was override
by KOLLA_CEPH_OSD_BOOTSTRAP_D.

To create two partitions, we need to remove mklabel gpt
in second command to create patition.

Closes-Bug: #1702500

Change-Id: Ic4e9da5d8c24c666319e728e38e55f23305c2134
Signed-off-by: jangseon ryu <jangseon.ryu@navercorp.com>

commit_message:
Support ceph device classes feature

Device classes[1] is a new property of OSD. This feature allows the
data in the ceph pool to be placed in the specified OSDs. Only need
to specify the corresponding device class in the crush rule.

This commit supports the device classes feature and updates the steps
to create a pool.

[1]https://ceph.com/community/new-luminous-crush-device-classes/

Change-Id: Icd09101d10088955337b32026361983c6b7d5c7c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-29 07:21:37.000000000', 'message': 'Support for specifying ceph services to be deployed

Currently, deploying ceph using kolla-ansible will include all
enabled services, such as mon, mgr, osd, rgw and mds, etc. But the
disadvantage is that modifying one service may affect all other
services.
For example, when osd is broken, the user only wants to redeploy osd
and does not want to redeploy other services.

This function can be used with --limit (limit the node that the task
executes), so that you can modify a service on a node.

Change-Id: Ia904d98b2677a478bf67df45b5d36193fc52766a
Closes-bug: #1822250
'}, {'created': '2019-04-22 05:28:48.000000000', 'message': 'Support for specifying ceph daemons to be deployed

Currently, deploying ceph using kolla-ansible will include all
enabled daemons, such as mon, mgr, osd, rgw and mds, etc. But the
disadvantage is that modifying one daemon may affect all other
daemons.
For example, when osd is broken, the user only wants to redeploy osd
and does not want to redeploy other daemons.

This function can be used with --limit (limit the node that the task

commit_message:
Support for specifying ceph daemons to be deployed

Currently, deploying ceph using kolla-ansible will include all
enabled daemons, such as mon, mgr, osd, rgw and mds, etc. But the
disadvantage is that modifying one daemon may affect all other
daemons.
For example, when osd is broken, the user only wants to redeploy osd
and does not want to redeploy other daemons.

This function can be used with --limit (limit the node that the task
executes), so that you can modify a daemon on a node.

Change-Id: Ia904d98b2677a478bf67df45b5d36193fc52766a
Closes-bug: #1822250

commit_message:
Replace merge_configs with merge_yaml

MongoDB uses YAML format config file. Kolla-ansible
needs to use merge_yaml rather than merger_configs
which for ini-style configs.

Change-Id: I27a9e762799905275e400cc0b53d4b1d4d4c7e84

commit_message:
POC: Enable check-requirements

This should enable check-requirements job which is a pre-requisite for
having a project listed under openstack requirements. This should allow
us to control the version of molecule being used during testing without
having to update our local requirements so often.

Change-Id: Iba95dceb1bc585702f558e706b65c20c62074b95
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/requirements/+/797620

commit_message:
Add mon detection to ceph deployment

When using '--limit' to deploy a node of ceph, such as repairing mon,
repairing osd and other tasks, kolla-ansbile will report an error.
This is because the current deployment must include the mon node to
set the 'delegate_host' parameter.

This commit fixes this problem.

Change-Id: Ic484467cfde2b00694d6685beb8c29b9b630cdbb
Closes-bug: #1822219

This patch retains the start_xxx.yml file, and puts the tasks that trigger the handle and configuration services in the corresponding file. The advantage of this is that it simplifies the code in deploy.yml and makes it easier to modify and maintain individual components.

The difference between the older deployment process and the new deployment process is that when ceph.conf and config.json are changed, it will cause the ceph container to restart.

The advantage of this is that if you change the configuration file, you don't have to manually restart the container. But the downside is that this will cause the container of your ceph cluster to restart, which may affect the health of the cluster and cause disruption of related services.

I implemented a more secure upgrade process, one by one, which is more secure. The upgrade process is serial rather than parallel, 
and each time a container is upgraded, the state of ceph is checked, and the next container is upgraded until the ceph state becomes HEALTH_OK.
 
This feature can also be used in the upgrade of the ceph version, if your cluster is particularly important, you can upgrade it in this way. Interested people can refer to:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582441/"}, {'account_id': 24250, 'date': '2018-07-17 05:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

'}, {'created': '2018-03-21 10:25:47.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize the deployment of ceph

Made some optimizations for the deployment of ceph.
As with other modules, no configuration file is generated for
components that are not enabled;
Added container detection, including mon, osd, and other components;
Because the dependencies between the components of the ceph are
strong, so the startup of each component is only triggered once in a
deployment. The deployment sequence does not change from the previous one.

Close-bug: #1712531

Change-Id: If00671d83174f18cacf1849ce331ace3477fa09f

Made some optimizations for the deployment of ceph.

1. As with other modules, no configuration file is generated for
components that are not enabled;

2. Added container detection, including mon, osd and other components;

3.The previous deployment only restarts the container when the image
changes. The current deployment process restarts the container when
the image changes or ceph.conf changes or config.json changes.

4. Because the dependencies between the components of the ceph are
strong, so the ceph deployment is divided into several parts, mon,
mgr, osd, rgw, mds, and finally nfs. The corresponding configuration
section is also changed to call separately.

Closes-bug: #1712531

'}, {'created': '2018-08-16 09:35:24.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize the deployment of ceph

Made some optimizations for the deployment of ceph.

1. Considering the startup sequence of ceph, it is necessary to
separately configure the service and trigger hanlder to restart the
service.
2. Adjusted the location of some tasks to make the service more
convenient to split.
3. Use the "include_task" dynamic loading feature to start the
service with start.yml.
4.The previous deployment only restarts the container when the image
changes. The current deployment process restarts the container when
the image changes or ceph.conf changes or config.json changes. In
particular, the "ceph_conf_change_restart" parameter has been added
to control whether the service is restarted when the configuration
file is changed.

Closes-bug: #1712531

Change-Id: If00671d83174f18cacf1849ce331ace3477fa09f

'}, {'created': '2019-05-08 02:48:03.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize the deployment of ceph

1. Considering the startup sequence of ceph, it is necessary to
separately configure the service and trigger hanlder to restart the
service.
2. Use the "include_task" dynamic loading feature to start the
service with start.yml.
3. Add mon's detection task, because 'delegate_host' must have a
value at the node where mon is located, which prevents us from using
'--limit' to fix the osd node separately.
4. The current deployment will affect all enabled services, which is
not conducive to maintaining the entire cluster. This commit adds
'ceph_install_daemons' so that we can control the services to be
installed.
5. The previous deployment only restarts the container when the image
changes. The current deployment process restarts the container when
the image changes or ceph.conf changes or config.json changes. Users
can use the "ceph_conf_change_restart" parameter to control whether
to restart the container when ceph.conf changes.
6. The osd container may have problems frequently. At this time, we
need to fix osd and not affect other osd, so we have to avoid image
changes, which makes us very passive, because sometimes the image will
fix some bugs. This commit adds a judgment on the running container.
Use 'ceph_container_running_restart' to avoid restarting the running
container in deploy.

Change-Id: If00671d83174f18cacf1849ce331ace3477fa09f
'}, {'created': '2019-05-09 02:33:44.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize the deployment of ceph

1. Considering the startup sequence of ceph, it is necessary to

value at the node where mon is located, which prevents us from using
'--limit' to fix the osd node separately.
4. The current deployment will affect all enabled services, which is
not conducive to maintaining the entire cluster. This commit adds
'ceph_install_daemons' so that we can control the services to be
installed.
5. The previous deployment only restarts the container when the image
changes. The current deployment process restarts the container when
the image changes or ceph.conf changes or config.json changes. Users
can use the "ceph_conf_change_restart" parameter to control whether
to restart the container when ceph.conf changes.
6. The osd container may have problems frequently. At this time, we
need to fix osd and not affect other osd, so we have to avoid image
changes, which makes us very passive, because sometimes the image will
fix some bugs. This commit adds a judgment on the running container.
Use 'ceph_container_running_restart' to avoid restarting the running
container in deploy.

Change-Id: If00671d83174f18cacf1849ce331ace3477fa09f
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize the deployment of ceph

1. Considering the startup sequence of ceph, it is necessary to
separately configure the service and trigger hanlder to restart the
service.
2. Use the "include_task" dynamic loading feature to start the
service with start.yml.
3. Add mon's detection task, because 'delegate_host' must have a
value at the node where mon is located, which prevents us from using
'--limit' to fix the osd node separately.
4. The current deployment will affect all enabled services, which is
not conducive to maintaining the entire cluster. This commit adds
'ceph_install_daemons' so that we can control the services to be
installed.
5. The previous deployment only restarts the container when the image
changes. The current deployment process restarts the container when
the image changes or ceph.conf changes or config.json changes. Users
can use the "ceph_conf_change_restart" parameter to control whether
to restart the container when ceph.conf changes.
6. The osd container may have problems frequently. At this time, we
need to fix osd and not affect other osd, so we have to avoid image
changes, which makes us very passive, because sometimes the image will
fix some bugs. This commit adds a judgment on the running container.
Use 'ceph_container_running_restart' to avoid restarting the running
container in deploy.

Change-Id: If00671d83174f18cacf1849ce331ace3477fa09f

subject: modify variable monasca_grafana_server_port
messages:
[{'account_id': 24061, 'date': '2019-05-06 01:25:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24061, 'date': '2019-05-06 06:34:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-05-07 15:36:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

The two variables have different defaults - monasca_grafana_server_port is 3001, grafana_server_port is 3000. This change would break existing users.

What's the reason for the change?"}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-05-07 15:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

It is perhaps confusing that there are two versions of Grafana. `grafana_server_port` is for the vanilla version, and `monasca_grafana_server_port` is for a fork of Grafana 4 which has Keystone integration. This version is specifically for Monasca.

The vanilla version can also be used with Monasca, but you need to supply a token to the Monasca datasource, rather than logging in with your OpenStack credentials.'}, {'account_id': 24061, 'date': '2019-05-08 01:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think monitoring is better as a standalone system. Monitoring data should also be able to view when keystone is broken'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-05-09 11:25:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I think monitoring is better as a standalone system. Monitoring
 > data should also be able to view when keystone is broken

That's not the monasca model. Monasca uses Keystone for auth, and is multi-tenant by design. Without requiring users to authenticate in grafana it would break the multi-tenancy."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-05-09 11:26:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > I think monitoring is better as a standalone system. Monitoring
 > > data should also be able to view when keystone is broken
 > 
 > That's not the monasca model. Monasca uses Keystone for auth, and
 > is multi-tenant by design. Without requiring users to authenticate
 > in grafana it would break the multi-tenancy.

You can still deploy grafana with monasca - just set enable_grafana to true. You'll then get a grafana service without keystone integration, listening on grafana_server_port."}, {'account_id': 24061, 'date': '2019-05-10 01:10:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I see;thank you'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-11-15 17:11:15.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Doug Szumski with the following votes:

* Code-Review-1 by Doug Szumski <doug@stackhpc.com>
'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-22 10:02:24.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

monasca grafana dropped'}]

commit_message:
Use specific Haproxy command

When kolla's patch 671178 is merged, haproxy
command will be the same in different distros.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/671178
Change-Id: Id8826adcb7e6b020bff065cb32f2c756eb305570

subject: Add octavia default heartbeats vars
messages:
[{'account_id': 27671, 'date': '2021-03-22 21:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-03-23 09:40:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Dmitry, in general we try to avoid adding these one-to-one configuration options. It adds to the total variable namespace and complexity of kolla ansible. We also take ownership of the default value.

Have you seen this documentation about customising services in Kolla Ansible: https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-ansible/latest/admin/advanced-configuration.html#openstack-service-configuration-in-kolla'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-03-23 09:40:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 27671, 'date': '2021-03-23 10:29:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Hi Dmitry, in general we try to avoid adding these one-to-one configuration options. It adds to the total variable namespace and complexity of kolla ansible. We also take ownership of the default value.
> 
> Have you seen this documentation about customising services in Kolla Ansible: https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-ansible/latest/admin/advanced-configuration.html#openstack-service-configuration-in-kolla

Thanks, Mark. I thought it's may be useful. Got it about default values."}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-22 09:50:27.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add vendor_passthru method for subscriptions

This patch adds two new vendor_passthru methods for Redfish:
- create_subscription (create a sbuscription)
- delete_subscription (delete a subscription)
- get_all_subscriptions (get all subscriptions on the node)
- get_subscription (get a single subscription)

Unit Tests in test_utils split into multiple classes to avoid random
failures due to cache.

Tested in bifrost env using two different HW:
- HPE EL8000 e910
- Dell R640

Story: #2009061
Task: #42854
Change-Id: I5b7fa99b0ee64ccdc0f62d9686df655082db3665

subject: Fix empty match while setting supported_policy_files
messages: [{'account_id': 27330, 'date': '2021-07-02 15:59:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-07-05 09:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-07-22 08:22:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-02 15:59:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix empty match while setting supported_policy_files

When supported_policy_files gets set under python 3.7 [1], the regex '(.*)'
matches twice, once for the policy file name and once more for the empty string
that follows the policy file name. This is new behavior under python
3.7. [2]

This leads to the replacement string being written out twice resulting
in something like this: "nova_policy.yamlnova_".

This patch changes the regex to '(.+)' ensuring there is no match success
against the empty string.

[1]:
- set_fact:
    supported_policy_files: "{{ supported_policy_format_list | map('regex_replace', '(.*)', '{{ project_name }}_\\1') | list }}"

[2]: https://docs.python.org/3/library/re.html#re.sub

Change-Id: Ie5278832e293364c66d53ddb07dff9c5409f0cc6
Closes-Bug: 1851249
(cherry picked from commit 9d0ccad15aa358cdc6dc2f690bf181cb8354d150)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix empty match while setting supported_policy_files

When supported_policy_files gets set under python 3.7 [1], the regex '(.*)'
matches twice, once for the policy file name and once more for the empty string
that follows the policy file name. This is new behavior under python
3.7. [2]

This leads to the replacement string being written out twice resulting
in something like this: "nova_policy.yamlnova_".

This patch changes the regex to '(.+)' ensuring there is no match success
against the empty string.

[1]:
- set_fact:
    supported_policy_files: "{{ supported_policy_format_list | map('regex_replace', '(.*)', '{{ project_name }}_\\1') | list }}"

[2]: https://docs.python.org/3/library/re.html#re.sub

Change-Id: Ie5278832e293364c66d53ddb07dff9c5409f0cc6
Closes-Bug: 1851249
(cherry picked from commit 9d0ccad15aa358cdc6dc2f690bf181cb8354d150)

commit_message:
Adding molecule test for fetch-images role

This patch adds a molecule scenario using the docker driver for the
fetch-images roles. It avoids fetching from network since tests
cannot rely on that to pass or not, and uses file:/// to get the
image and calculate the md5sum.

Change-Id: I53bbbfa17203191b98595b2125dee3bf312fd912
Taiga: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/1460

commit_message:
Assure we use full module name for firewalld

- fixes issue which can prevent Ansible from finding the right
  module (newer linter reported it)
- bumped linter versions

commit_message:
Add py39 testing and support

We are switching to use the python3-wallaby template [1] but with
py39 voting so we explicitly override and add it to the gate. We also
want to keep py37 tests so this is also added to the gate as the wallaby
template doesn't cover it.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/commit/c5112bc8a155f0c37174ce419bed57a1fc80dd04/zuul.d/project-templates.yaml#L612

Change-Id: Id9dc68ce9763c3524b060d7824740b1d7c4ba41b

commit_message:
gnocchi: add python3-rados to gnocchi-base source image

The binary images include python3-rados as a dependency, but source
images do not. This change fixes that.

Change-Id: I2c8cdfcd25856ecdcfd9f302965187b3b62376ad
Closes-Bug: #1927756
(cherry picked from commit c29f818696c74fd32b929a763695d244e112a33c)

commit_message:
Add molecule dependencies

As several projects are using molecule testing framework to
test ansible bit, it makes sense to add them to upper constraints so
we can avoid conflicts or regressions from newer releases.

Change-Id: Ia818ded9a5a38bd6c54e6674c37f2e7f4e7584ab

Ignored errors do make debugging of failed builds much harder.

commit_message:
Fixes ignored failure to run repo config-manager

Because we used `|| true`, we failed to spot the missing sudo for a
very long time.

New code avoids global ignore of errors and enables epel only if
is found among the available repos.

Change-Id: I4bb8878d3dd5b0bd449f6c8659c92bc31388e010
Example: https://review.rdoproject.org/zuul/build/cf703d876f5740088f0571fd8e5cf82f

- removes lots of flake8 ignored errors which are automatically
  fixed by black reformatting
- activate black
- move flake8 config to recommended official location in order to
  assure it used by all tools (any config put inside pre-commit would
  not be available outside it)

Note that all the files touched that are not in the root of this

is the same before and after the reformatting.

commit_message:
Make use of black formatting

- removes lots of flake8 ignored errors which are automatically
  fixed by black reformatting
- activate black
- move flake8 config to recommended official location in order to
  assure it used by all tools (any config put inside pre-commit would
  not be available outside it)

Note that all the files touched that are not in the root of this
repository were reformatted by black, which assures that the byte-code
is the same before and after the reformatting.

Change-Id: Ie463d17a71b2c85a0951aabfd5637f28c809d257

commit_message:
WIP: Test use of tox-ansible as test runner

This change aims to reuse tox-ansible plugin in order to eliminate
most of our custom code used for running molecule scenarios.

When ready it should work like:
- each molecule scenario would be visible as a tox environment,
  running `tox -va` will display all available scenarios and which
  effective molecule commands they really run
- zuul will call tox for scenarios
- developers should be able to run a specific scenario locally by
  just calling `tox -e scenario-name`

Change-Id: I193b2c583921a8cd4c83267dc23e051be553f6bc

commit_message:
Run flake8 using pre-commit

- Runs flake8 using pre-commit so we can easily add other
  linters/hooks and keep them isolated.
- Moves flake8 config to recommended location
- Upgrades hacking to latest version (4.4.0)
- Fixes problems reported by the upgraded linter

Change-Id: I80c190c24c907e5074e5e79edcdfc08bec689fb3
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/hacking/+/783820

[{'created': '2021-04-07 17:47:08.000000000', 'message': '[stable-only] Cap bandit and fix constraints

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] but the release
is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

With the introduction of the new dependency resolver in 20.3 pip the
lower-constraints job starts to fail as now the constraints are working
as they should. Multiple fixes needed:
* lower-constraints job uses the [testenv]install_command, so it gives
  both the upper-constraints and lower-constraints, which causes the
  job to fail. As an easy fix install_command is added to this target
  without the upper constraints.
* duplicate stestr constraint removed
* cryptography lower constraint is bumped as with version 2.1 the
  new resolver of pip takes hours to install the packages
* lower-constraints test job failed with error message:
  "[..] unexpected keyword argument 'barbican_endpoint_type'"
  which is due to old version of castellan.

Conflicts:
    requirements.txt
    test-requirements.txt

NOTE(elod.illes): some requirements change is not necessary in stein,
thus, were removed.

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit and fix constraints

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] but the release
is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

With the introduction of the new dependency resolver in 20.3 pip the
lower-constraints job starts to fail as now the constraints are working
as they should. Multiple fixes needed:
* lower-constraints job uses the [testenv]install_command, so it gives
  both the upper-constraints and lower-constraints, which causes the
  job to fail. As an easy fix install_command is added to this target
  without the upper constraints.
* duplicate stestr constraint removed
* cryptography lower constraint is bumped as with version 2.1 the
  new resolver of pip takes hours to install the packages
* lower-constraints test job failed with error message:
  "[..] unexpected keyword argument 'barbican_endpoint_type'"
  which is due to old version of castellan.

Conflicts:
    requirements.txt
    test-requirements.txt

NOTE(elod.illes): some requirements change is not necessary in stein,
thus, were removed. On the other hand, sphinx requirement had to be
added to make requirements-check job pass.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615
[3] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/663
[4] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/665

Change-Id: I4b33c2544c911bd68ed8af4c754c9f5dc0c93be8
(cherry picked from commit 43997de7bda3c0f3dcd4c8ec234167122cadd529)

sorry I don't understand your comment can you please elaborate? are you saying we need them to be a list of playbooks so that folks can run them one at a time?

But then why is it ok to change it in other cases but not in this one? eg https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/736468 https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/764657


Not sure what you mean by 'Maybe we don't need this and can remove this test' which test are you referring to?"}, {'account_id': 9976, 'date': '2021-01-14 18:36:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

true we a list of playbooks is easier but we have used the one playbook solution elsewhere.
If we are to take exception with this - we should have objected to the other proposed patches'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2021-01-14 21:57:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

There are obviously 2 workarounds so far for this problem: using a single playbook or make task conditional.
Workaround which uses a single playbook prevents us from testing case with multiple playbooks, which is still used and needed somewhere I believe.
Workaround with conditional usage of delegate_to doesn't require us to decrease a test coverage as first does.
From workaround that decreases test coverage and workaround that doesn't decrease, I choose the second one.
If we merged one patch with wrong workaround it doesn't mean in any way we need to continue to do this mistake again and again, there are no legal precedents here.
I'd prefer to create a workaround with avoiding delegate_to and then revert ovb patch that made it running in a single playbook."}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-01-15 14:05:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Switch tripleo-ci-base-multinode job to use single playbook

As described in the related bug we are seeing timeouts here and
using a single playbook has been shown to fix it.

commit_message:
[DNM] Fix ResolutionImpossible on tox invocation

DO NOT MERGE: this is an early validation of an upcoming

commit_message:
db: Remove old sqlalchemy-migrate migrations

These are no longer used and no longer necessary. Remove them.

Change-Id: Ibd7d46aefb3794dd342c8afb40dbb8d4ce00a976
Implements: blueprint remove-sqlalchemy-migrate
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
BaR - Ceph Backup

Backup and Restore:
  This task aims to take a backup of the /var/lib/ceph directory and
copied to the shared directory.
  To be able to do it, we copy the way that the ceph-ansible project [1]
deactivates the mds [2], so we can stop all the ceph services on the
controllers.

[1]-https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/
[2]-https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/blob/v4.0.14/infrastructure-playbooks/rolling_update.yml#L550-L623

I left the comment below to describe and give some backgroud.
** Just splitting the patch into patches.
All the Randy's comments are implemented.
The other patch is https://review.opendev.org/#/c/732399/

Change-Id: I55681d69cacf2e7bee52d9a61f12d8577fe15a2d
(cherry picked from commit a930407217c7478a4b0141d28b9377973d840f97)

commit_message:
db: Stop checking for DB under sqlalchemy-migrate control

This has been in place since Ocata. If any version since then has been
deployed, this will have already been deployed. Time to drop this.

UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: I5412d78c63cf3381782f5c6fc059641489f89053
Implements: blueprint remove-sqlalchemy-migrate
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

"}, {'created': '2021-06-10 01:58:36.000000000', 'message': 'fix:fix an error while changing redis volume size

Trove version:rocky
In the logic of disk unloading of single redis instace,the exception loopingcall.LoopingCallDone which used to break out and stop a LoopingCallBase can not be catched;
Please see the function trove.common.utils.build_polling_task.
As a result, taskmanger raise a timeout error,volume-resize faild.

Steps to reproduce:
Create a single redis instance,then use cmd "trove resize-volume INSTANCE_ID 32" to expand volume from 16G to 32G,then an error occured.

Error log from taskmanager:
2021-06-01 19:25:16.652 25165 ERROR oslo_messaging.rpc.server GuestError: An error occurred communicating with the guest: Looping call timed out after
1.18 seconds.
Error log from guestagent:
ERROR oslo.service.loopingcall %self._error_time)
ERROR oslo.service.rpc.server %self._error_time)

Description about the error:
  Use cmd "trove show  INSTANCE_ID" ,the field volume is 32G. Then you log in to this nova_instance,use cmd "df -h",the size of Corresponding filesystem is still 16G.

Fix:To raise the extra Loopingcall.LoopcallDone exception in trove.guestagent.volume._wait_for_monut

task: 42538
story: error while changing redis volume size

In the logic of disk unloading of single redis instace,the exception loopingcall.LoopingCallTimeOut can not be catched;
The method trove.guestagent.volume._wait_for_mount return "True"
As a result, taskmanger raise a timeout error,volume-resize faild.

Steps to reproduce:
Create a single redis instance,then use cmd "trove resize-volume INSTANCE_ID 32" to expand volume from 16G to 32G,then an error occured.

commit_message:
fix:fix an error while changing redis volume size

Trove version:rocky
In the logic of disk unloading of single redis instace,the exception loopingcall.LoopingCallTimeOut can not be catched;
The method trove.guestagent.volume._wait_for_mount return "True"
As a result, taskmanger raise a timeout error,volume-resize faild.

Steps to reproduce:
Create a single redis instance,then use cmd "trove resize-volume INSTANCE_ID 32" to expand volume from 16G to 32G,then an error occured.

Error log from taskmanager:
2021-06-01 19:25:16.652 25165 ERROR oslo_messaging.rpc.server GuestError: An error occurred communicating with the guest: Looping call timed out after
1.18 seconds.
Error log from guestagent:
ERROR oslo.service.loopingcall %self._error_time)
ERROR oslo.service.rpc.server %self._error_time)

Description about the error:
  Use cmd "trove show  INSTANCE_ID" ,the field volume is 32G. Then you log in to this nova_instance,use cmd "df -h",the size of Corresponding filesystem is still 16G.

Fix:To raise the extra Loopingcall.LoopcallTimeOut exception in trove.guestagent.volume._wait_for_monut

task: 42538
story: error while changing redis volume size
Change-Id: I2204a8821cee72b3c8969ade0f173c3e5f28f5c5

commit_message:
db: Replace sqlalchemy-migrate call with alembic equivalent

The 'ocata_expand01_add_visibility' alembic migration was calling
'alter' on a table column, something that is only possible once you've
monkey patched sqlalchemy by importing the 'migrate' module. Resolve
this.

Change-Id: Ic71710aebafa38dceeead104b3e97fafa4bb4362
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Auto find greatest Fedora cloud image sub-release

Fedora cloud images have sub-releases in their filename. It is not
exacly clear how this is generated but we do know how we can determine
the greatest programatically.

Change-Id: I7fc56897c681fe037db211c290edcdd23cdd5d5b

commit_message:
gnocchi: add python3-rados to gnocchi-base source image

The binary images include python3-rados as a dependency, but source
images do not. This change fixes that.

Closes-Bug: #1927756

commit_message:
Replace deprecated import of ABCs from collections

ABCs in collections should be imported from collections.abc and direct
import from collections is deprecated since Python 3.3.

Change-Id: Idacff95cbb276eda0bc55de771ce6c701363c2e1

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-04 20:51:19.000000000', 'message': 'Magic Search filter facet removal fix

When there is a text search and a filter facet applied together,
deleting the filter facet makes the remaining text search ignored.
This patch fixes it, calling text search if text facet remains.

Closes-Bug: #1930929

Change-Id: I343dc4220d572669a1b36ed9cf2d10d4dacf7166
'}]
commit_message:
Magic Search filter facet removal fix

When there is a text search and a filter facet applied together,
deleting the filter facet makes the remaining text search ignored.
This patch fixes it, calling text search if text facet remains.

Closes-Bug: #1930929

Change-Id: I343dc4220d572669a1b36ed9cf2d10d4dacf7166

subject: WIP: Add freebsd disk image
messages:
[{'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2021-04-01 14:56:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2021-04-01 14:56:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-04-01 15:12:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

One thing to keep in mind is that any steps running in a chroot on top of this image are unlikely to work on Linux as the binary format will not be ELF. There is also the problem of mounting UFS on linux (technically possible but variants differ and I think you want to specify exactly how to mount the freebsd variant?).

That said running something like this on top of FreeBSD should be straightforward though there is a bit of chicken and egg from a testing perspective.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2021-07-22 07:32:11.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

If someone else wants to takeover, they are welcomed.'}]

commit_message:
Move placement specs to placement repo

Mistakenly the computing team merged two specs in nova that actually
targeting the placement service. Placement has its own specs directory
to store these. So this patch removes these specs and adds redirect for
them to point to the placement repository.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/placement/+/800769

Change-Id: I00662becb350557ba96bb119c91443ce27064782

commit_message:
Zanata stats tool: improve speed with user API

This patch enhances the speed of Zanata stats by using
user-based Zanata APIs rather than project-based APIs,
which took >1 days as more Zanata users and translation data
were accumulated.

Note that the API scheme follows with Stackalytics
: https://opendev.org/x/stackalytics/src/branch/master/stackalytics/processor/zanata.py#L38

Change-Id: Ia2462447f7a0cc2534e877976838de09e8683e89

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Since setuptools v54.1.0[1], dash-separated options causes a warning
message like [2] and we should replace dashes with underscores.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

[2]
UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
'description_file' instead

Change-Id: I05d9c484bb669ae33211e88924b20b7cfe7d0d67

commit_message:
Add missing font for PDF generation

openstack-tox-docs job started to fail with the following error:

! LaTeX Error: File `tgtermes.sty' not found.

This patch adds the required font package to bindep doc profile.

Co-authored-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Closes-Bug: #1935742
Change-Id: Idc7ba5b1211327a258b2972f9271b09916598cb3

Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration in the
repo openstack/ironic on branch master.  The error was:

  Configuration item has more than one key.  Each zuul.yaml
  configuration file must be a list of dictionaries with a
  single key, for example:
  
  - job:
      name: foo
  
  - project:
      name: bar
  
  Ensure that every item in the list is a dictionary with only
  one key (in this example, 'job' and 'project').  This error
  may be caused by insufficient indentation of the keys under
  the configuration item ('name' in this example)."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-03-05 16:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2021-03-05 16:49:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Scoped RBAC Devstack Plugin support

Adds support to the ironic devstack plugin to configure
ironic to be used in a scope-enforcing mode in line with
the Secure RBAC effort. This change also defines two new
integration jobs *and* changes one of the existing
integration.

In these cases, we're testing functional crub interactions,
integration with nova, and integration with ironic-inspector.

As other services come online with their plugins and
devstack code being able to set the appropriate scope
enforcement configuration, we will be able to change the
overall operating default for all of ironic's jobs and
exclude the differences.

This effort identified issues in ironic-tempest-plugin,
tempest, devstack, and required plugin support in
ironic-inspector as well, and is ultimately required
to ensure we do not break the Secure RBAC.

Luckilly, it all works.

Change-Id: Ic40e47cb11a6b6e9915efcb12e7912861f25cae7

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-29 15:10:04.000000000', 'message': 'Debug stale image property removal

Occasionally we fail to delete a property from an image and get a
StaleDataError from SQLAlchemy. It looks like maybe we are just racing
to delete the same thing and can ignore this error, but we need more
information. This catches that error and logs information about
the property we are trying to delete before re-raising.

Change-Id: Ida5bc659b7481fa0a7f3926a54520628a7a4c406
Related-Bug: #1895173
'}, {'created': '2021-03-29 15:42:53.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore stale image property removal

Occasionally we fail to delete a property from an image and get a
StaleDataError from SQLAlchemy. It looks like maybe we are just racing
with another operation to delete a single property (i.e. a race
between image delete and the end of an import cleanup).

This ignores that "can't delete because it is already deleted" error
and logs to debug about the situation for later auditing and
confirmation.

Change-Id: Ida5bc659b7481fa0a7f3926a54520628a7a4c406
Closes-Bug: #1895173

commit_message:
Ignore stale image property removal

Occasionally we fail to delete a property from an image and get a
StaleDataError from SQLAlchemy. It looks like maybe we are just racing
with another operation to delete a single property (i.e. a race
between image delete and the end of an import cleanup).

This ignores that "can't delete because it is already deleted" error
and logs to debug about the situation for later auditing and
confirmation.

Change-Id: Ida5bc659b7481fa0a7f3926a54520628a7a4c406
Closes-Bug: #1895173

commit_message:
db: Move 'schema' module up a level

We want to remove the old sqlalchemy-migrate based migrations. Move the
only remaining module we need from this up a level so we can 'rm -rf'
the entire directory in a future change.

Change-Id: I3b1a1668c48e3136fd91b1418e00c38deec76bb5
Implements: blueprint remove-sqlalchemy-migrate
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
