commit_message:
container-reconciler: support multiple processes

This follows the same pattern of configuration used in the
object-expirer.  When the container-recociler has a configuration value
for processes it expects that many instances of the reconciler to be
configured with a process value from [0, processes).

Change-Id: Ie46bda37ca3f6e692ec31a4ddcd46f343fb1aeca

commit_message:
vdpa: Introducing the vdpa PF flag

Now that nova supports vDPA interfaces, we need to configure them using
os_net_config for tripleo consumption.

Related: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-docs/+/798237/
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1917762
Change-Id: I202fe57360cca79883457444bdae2cf41ba25798
(cherry picked from commit baab05e9bb2850d76275a9397036c1a8d4a9131a)

commit_message:
Dark Data Watcher: switch to agreement across the whole ring

Before, we required all servers that are up and reacheable
to agree that object is dark before we considered it as such
and triggered an action. But now that someone wanted to
run with action=delete, a concern was raised that a momentary
network split could easily make the watcher start deleting
objects. To guard against it, we now require all servers
in the whole ring agree than object is dark. As a side effect,
if one of container servers is down, the watcher is effectively
disabled now. But seems like a better choice than deleting
something by mistake.

Change-Id: I07fa2d39817bd34f7873731990e12ab991e14a6b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-21 18:02:27.000000000', 'message': "Fix the sysctl parameter used to tune connections

The documentation currently uses the sysctl parameter:
'net.ipv4.netfilter.ip_conntrack_max', but it's been deprecated
for a long time. This patch switches it to:
'net.netfilter.nf_conntrack_max', which is the modern equivalent.

Change-Id: I3fd5d4060840092bca53af7da7dbaaa600e936a3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the sysctl parameter used to tune connections

The documentation currently uses the sysctl parameter:
'net.ipv4.netfilter.ip_conntrack_max', but it's been deprecated
for a long time. This patch switches it to:
'net.netfilter.nf_conntrack_max', which is the modern equivalent.

Change-Id: I3fd5d4060840092bca53af7da7dbaaa600e936a3

[{'created': '2021-04-29 23:47:27.000000000', 'message': 'Add stable branch jobs on the plugins master gate

Supported stable branches in maintenance state
(ussuri, victoria, wallaby) use the Tempest and plugins master
version for their testing. To make sure master version (new
tests or any changes) is compatible with stable branch testing,
we need to add the stable branches job on the plugins master gate.
Tempest and many other plugins are already testing the stable
branches in same way[1].

Ussuri onwards, Tempest or plugins are py3 only, so we are
running only python3 version of stable jobs

Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

 [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/e8f1876aa6772077f85f380677b30251c2454505/.zuul.yaml#L646

Change-Id: Ie287353738783d5d9419102a38cfae9477db704e
'}]
commit_message:
Add stable branch jobs on the plugins master gate

Supported stable branches in maintenance state
(ussuri, victoria, wallaby) use the Tempest and plugins master
version for their testing. To make sure master version (new
tests or any changes) is compatible with stable branch testing,
we need to add the stable branches job on the plugins master gate.
Tempest and many other plugins are already testing the stable
branches in same way[1].

Ussuri onwards, Tempest or plugins are py3 only, so we are
running only python3 version of stable jobs

Tempest plugins guide for stable branch testing:
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_testing_policy.html

 [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/src/commit/e8f1876aa6772077f85f380677b30251c2454505/.zuul.yaml#L646

Change-Id: Ie287353738783d5d9419102a38cfae9477db704e

commit_message:
Revert "[OVN][Placement] Add a SB Chassis event to track changes in BW config"

This reverts commit df5cb28737453e2dfee17e177160fa6d7a59b7e0.

The reverted commit triggers the failure of tempest-slow-py3 job.
tempest-slow-py3 is equal to non-voting neutron-ovn-tempest-slow job
in the neutron CI. It is a non-voting job so the error was not detected
before merging it. To recover the tempest job in OpenStack wide,
this commit reverts it.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-July/023764.html

Closes-Bug: #1936983
Change-Id: Id8cdd9c69e4fef2d9c335447b498958add8b7816

commit_message:
reconciler: default processes to 1 instead of 0

Behaviorally, these are equivalent, but it makes more sense in my head
if we default to dividing work among a single process than zero.

Change-Id: I03fde2e330926670ee5f740eee3e567986d374c1

commit_message:
Make code compatible with SQLAlchemy 1.4.18

Also, plugins do not need to enable any network service other than what
devstack is already doing [1].

Also, fix doc build:
- bump up tox minversion to 3.18
- set ignore_basepython_conflict to True [2]
- add tex-gyre to binddep.txt [3]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/791436
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/a0ec2de968cfded8b88c2f3af1152b5932d675b7/tox.ini#L7
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-health/+/793984

Change-Id: Ib6e3ed40dc8b075c3cecb967b7417097e3cab60d
Co-authored-by: Ghanshyam Mann <gmann@ghanshyammann.com>
(cherry picked from commit b2e20a11432103b664bafc0862252122063c32e6)

commit_message:
Trim line breaks from pacemaker bundle function

On CentOS9, the cibadmin query is returning '\n' if the bundle is not
defined which results in:

Error: Evaluation Error: Error while evaluating a Function Call, invalid
value for Integer(): "\n" (line: 1, column: 1) on node
standalone-0.localdomain

This change strips whitespace from the check to ensure it has a value
before we attempt to convert to an integer.

Change-Id: I369644d491357a8cdeae3eff51f4f595b1033b66

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-21 15:06:39.000000000', 'message': "[stable-only] Use bionic for requirements-check job

requirements-check jobs started to fail in stable/stein with

  ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'openstack_requirements'

This is due to that job runs in ubuntu-focal instead of ubuntu-bionic,
and openstack_requirements is not installed for python 3.8. By pinning
the nodeset to bionic we can eliminate this issue as in bionic the
python version is 3.6.

Change-Id: I077e6276618a257b2c948e58d4de993998844827
"}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] Use bionic for requirements-check job

requirements-check jobs started to fail in stable/stein with

  ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'openstack_requirements'

This is due to that job runs in ubuntu-focal instead of ubuntu-bionic,
and openstack_requirements is not installed for python 3.8. By pinning
the nodeset to bionic we can eliminate this issue as in bionic the
python version is 3.6.

Change-Id: I077e6276618a257b2c948e58d4de993998844827

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-21 07:57:36.000000000', 'message': 'Switch from pacemaker standby to pacemaker stop

Currently, the "snapshots" backup is being taken after taking out one
node from the cluster using pcs node standby. The consequence of it is
that the standby property is also being backuped, so when the node is
restored, it appears as standby and it needs to be unstandby manually.

Switching to pcs cluster stop/pcs cluster start does not make the playbook take any
longer, nor it creates an impact on the time the vips take to be
migrated to a different node while provides the advantage that when the
node is restarted (during restore), pacemaker starts correctly without
any other manual step.

Change-Id: Ided482f7eaed8d5e1fac60679ef3ba07bda41c0c
(cherry picked from commit 0fb4873ca01c76350b162fcf574dafe970f760df)
(cherry picked from commit 76d61eaccbd4474b04f4b338f8edd1b2a6937f6f)
'}]
commit_message:
Switch from pacemaker standby to pacemaker stop

Currently, the "snapshots" backup is being taken after taking out one
node from the cluster using pcs node standby. The consequence of it is
that the standby property is also being backuped, so when the node is
restored, it appears as standby and it needs to be unstandby manually.

Switching to pcs cluster stop/pcs cluster start does not make the playbook take any
longer, nor it creates an impact on the time the vips take to be
migrated to a different node while provides the advantage that when the
node is restarted (during restore), pacemaker starts correctly without
any other manual step.

Change-Id: Ided482f7eaed8d5e1fac60679ef3ba07bda41c0c
(cherry picked from commit 0fb4873ca01c76350b162fcf574dafe970f760df)
(cherry picked from commit 76d61eaccbd4474b04f4b338f8edd1b2a6937f6f)

[FFWD upgrade] Adding support in compute name pattern

The playbooks rely on group['compute'] naming
while it could be as follwoing:
[computehciovsdpdk]
computehciovsdpdk-1
computehciovsdpdk-0

Change-Id: Idc1add605147a05a711c72d2cd25f5498b11e8d4

commit_message:
Retire django-openstack-auth

``django_openstack_auth`` code was merged into the main horizon
repository during the queens release. This repo is already
deprecated and now we can retire it. This patch removes all
references of ``django_openstack_auth`` as mentioned in [1].
Also, this patch takes care of step 2(End project Gating)
and and step 4(Remove Project) because
step 1(Stop requirements syncing) and step3(Remove Project Content)
is  already handled by If04778ccc99ea92355378d59e616d8794e36ea14
and I74b10a90fe79fc768cfb8de6f68d3cd2f4938e51 respectively.

Note: this patch doesn't drop the official-openstack-repo-jobs template
and noop-job because noop-job is needs to be defined for the check and
gate queues to merge a patch and official-openstack-repo-jobs is needed
to syncup the changed in github repo once Ib811fb321d18fc01f3786f8b3ab16b2eda558864
merged we can drop this template and noop-job.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/repository.html#retiring-a-repository

Change-Id: Ifa691c2d2e7ac8bb502c8fae7dbdcc89fa4ef825

commit_message:
Increase octavia's lb_build_timeout setting for fs062

The default value for load_balancer.lb_build_timeout is 900s (15min) in
featureset062.
octavia-tempest-plugin has been hitting this timeout often since amphora
images are based on centos-stream. Let's increase this value to 1200s
(20min).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/801266

Change-Id: I7694b5ca68117cf97b4ad472a07ea276773cdd91

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-22 07:21:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix expect_timeout_error in IPv6 scenario tests

Fix except_timeout_error call to make_request. In case of an IPv6
address, make_request expects brackets around the address (ex:
[2001:12::2]).

Some tests failed with the following error: "Validate URL got exception:
Failed to parse: http://fd22:262a:41e1:1::f5:97. Retrying.". Then the
requests timed out because each retry failed and not for the excepted
reason (which is: SG update was applied)
Because of that issue, some IPv6 tests based on
_test_listener_with_allowed_cidrs may have failed because the tests
considered that the SG were applied, while the traffic could still pass.

Change-Id: I2e6d108a8d4ce197ae657ea10b10f63b1a5850c4
'}, {'created': '2021-06-22 09:33:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix expect_timeout_error in IPv6 scenario tests

Fix except_timeout_error call to make_request. In case of an IPv6
address and a TCP-based protocol, make_request expects brackets around
the address (ex: [2001:12::2]).

Some tests failed with the following error: "Validate URL got exception:
Failed to parse: http://fd22:262a:41e1:1::f5:97. Retrying.". Then the
requests timed out because each retry failed and not for the excepted
reason (which is: SG update was applied)
Because of that issue, some IPv6 tests based on
_test_listener_with_allowed_cidrs may have failed because the tests
considered that the SG were applied, while the traffic could still pass.

Change-Id: I2e6d108a8d4ce197ae657ea10b10f63b1a5850c4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix expect_timeout_error in IPv6 scenario tests

Fix except_timeout_error call to make_request. In case of an IPv6
address and a TCP-based protocol, make_request expects brackets around
the address (ex: [2001:12::2]).

Some tests failed with the following error: "Validate URL got exception:
Failed to parse: http://fd22:262a:41e1:1::f5:97. Retrying.". Then the
requests timed out because each retry failed and not for the excepted
reason (which is: SG update was applied)
Because of that issue, some IPv6 tests based on
_test_listener_with_allowed_cidrs may have failed because the tests
considered that the SG were applied, while the traffic could still pass.

Change-Id: I2e6d108a8d4ce197ae657ea10b10f63b1a5850c4

commit_message:
Properly retire neutron-lbaas

neutron-lbaas is retired completly but
missed to update the project-config for all
the steps mentioned in
- https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/repository.html#retiring-a-repository

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lbaas/+/800143
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-lbaas-dashboard/+/800144

Change-Id: I3ef3852723f82d24bd5d591c2f9610ff83eb31ad

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-27 11:33:07.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Enable http response extraction

This patch is a preparation for adding RBAC tests.
Currently, we only return the body without the response
in manila REST client. The response is necessary for
the testing, because we need to check the returned code
status and to compare it with the expected status.
This way we will check if the user has the right
permissions for the action.

Change-Id: If0e39afb635c469a25919770a869087bf5def561

commit_message:
Enable http response extraction

This patch is a preparation for adding RBAC tests.
Currently, we only return the body without the response
in manila REST client. The response is necessary for
the testing, because we need to check the returned code
status and to compare it with the expected status.
This way we will check if the user has the right
permissions for the action.

Change-Id: If0e39afb635c469a25919770a869087bf5def561

commit_message:
Replace deprecated inspect.getargspec

inspect.getargspec was deprecated since Python 3.0 and
inspect.getfullargspec is its replacement with correct handling of
function annotations and keyword-only parameters[1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getargspec

Change-Id: I2f5c95b9dd00a2460e81788343c47a5206589693

commit_message:
[upgrade] Rename running interfaces too

To avoid a reboot, we also rename the running interfaces.
To ensure that this works correctly, we also remove the
removal of the persistant names actor.

Change-Id: I67efcdfda10af7fc4b617a693d56dacb7f14021d

commit_message:
Make the name of default Keystone site for Apache2 a platform option

Since at least Debian 9 (Stretch) the name of the relevant site has been
'wsgi-keystone' rather than 'keystone'. Then again, as of 21.04 Ubuntu
continues to use the old site name.

Tha relevant attribute is also set for RHEL so that recipe validation
doesn't fail due to missing resource name, even though the resource in
question is currently guarded by 'if platform_family?("debian")'.

Signed-off-by: Marek Szuba <m.szuba@gsi.de>
Change-Id: I34b342d0b51cd5e11b1e5de95578ac47939895f9

commit_message:
Drop horizon-nodejs10-jobs template

As we already added horizon-nodejs14-jobs template in this plugin
and nodejs14 jobs running fine. So let's drop horizon-nodejs10-jobs
template because nodejs10 is already EOL.

Change-Id: I11176ef54ca25b130bc2c1c86b8458cbf960312f

commit_message:
docs: Update release management for Xena process

At the Kolla Xena PTG [1] we discussed making some changes to the
release process, as well as improving documentation around some of the
less well documented steps. Since then, a draft proposal was circulated
[2], and discussed in IRC meetings [3].

This change updates the release management documentation based on the
agreed process. It also includes Kayobe release steps which were
previously documented separately [4].

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/kolla-xena-ptg
[2] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/kolla-release-process-draft
[3] https://meetings.opendev.org/meetings/kolla/2021/kolla.2021-06-02-15.02.log.html#l-81
[4] https://docs.openstack.org/kayobe/latest/contributor/releases.html

commit_message:
Re-enable shell completion cache

This enables writing ids to a local completion
cache when using the manilaclient shell, which
allows tools/manila.bash_completion to complete
commands such as:
    manila delete a<tab>

Share ids are recorded on "manila list" operations.

Caching can be expanded to cover additional
types of manila objects using this same infrastructure.

Uses ~/.cache/manilaclient/ to match path standards,
and uses SHA-1 since Python running w/ FIPS mode may
not have MD5.

Also, fix a small bug in the fakes used in our test suite.
We were adding the shares count (an optional param) to all
the list responses, while this is something that should be done
only if the param with_count is set to True.

Co-Authored-By: Victoria Martinez de la Cruz <victoria@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1712835
Change-Id: I7f4dedf1dd4b7db6cf24fc1c4ed2a8d3685f714c

commit_message:
Allow for cron programming of backups

Normally, backups are not done interactively, but during nights or
weekends. This patch introduces the capacity of introducing in an easy
way cron programming that will execute backups in predictable intervals.

Closes-Bug: #1935675

Depends-on: I86b3fb2c3d846bcd56859e0d572f1fe4d5e148fa
Change-Id: I28219759922b7407121a3fa4d2f49ee1f4b8a3cd

commit_message:
Drop horizon-nodejs10-jobs template

As we already added horizon-nodejs14-jobs template in this plugin
and nodejs14 jobs running fine. So let's drop horizon-nodejs10-jobs
template because nodejs10 is already EOL.

Change-Id: I11176ef54ca25b130bc2c1c86b8458cbf960312f

commit_message:
Enable tempest tests for hostname sanitization

In Wallaby and later, nova sanitizes instance hostnames having
freeform characters with dashes. It should be tested in Devstack.

Relates to https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/764482/

Change-Id: I958c7d1c63af881f6320bc6634f414c3a012f99c

Manila-share service initialized correctly with CephFS back end and basic share create-delete test was successful:

http://logs.openstack.org/13/562213/10/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario004-multinode-oooq-container/b83c664/logs/subnode-2/var/log/containers/manila/manila-share.log.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-01-11 14:49:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-01-12 10:35:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1

scenari004 manila share logs show successful back end initialization and share creation/deletion.  Since this is on the undercloud I take it there's no pacemaker involved in service managment?  We still have the tech debt of adapting this job to run with ganesha and it will be "interesting" to see if we need to build a non-pacemaker path for it.  Of course we want to do that for edge eventually anyways but that won't be with current ganesha.  Much of our fragility with cephfs-nfs is around ganesha-with-pcs so it's not obvious that building a non-pcs, unsupported path here will be a gain.  Downstream CI is finally running for full HA path cephfs-nfs for osp13 so we have that coverage at least.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-02-13 21:57:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2019-02-13 21:59:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Let's look into why the two Ceph jobs failed:

001:
- ceph deployment ok [1]
- timed out on step5 when starting containers [2]
- 004 failed with same earlier but got past it now so I think 001 might work another time

004:
- ceph deployment ok [3] (we can ignore the pg warning)
- got past step5 with successful deployment [4]
- tempest got a 201 from the glance api after uploading cirros image at 1:30:32 [5]
- tempest then failed to parse the data it got back at 1:30:33 [6]
- no mention of images pool in ceph mon log or anything relevant at 1:30:33 [7]
- rgw log does not get 1:30:33 [8]
- the tempest stack track includes the store_image_file function [9]

Next question:

Why did Tempest get a TypeError [6] when trying to talk to Glance with store_image_file() [9] ?

One thing I notice is that in scenario001 cinder-volume service container is running with 12.2.11 ceph volume client rather than nautilus and the service fails to initialize because the client cannot connect to the cluster [1].  Similarly, in scenario004, manila-share service container is running with 12.2.11 volume client and has essentially the same  issue [2].

Cinder seems to be failing because of the following error [1] which makes sense because python-rados is not contained in the list of installed RPMs [2]. 

"VolumeBackendAPIException: Bad or unexpected response from the storage volume backend API: rados and rbd python libraries not found"

In another run of the same job today, with the older ceph-ansible, Cinder does not have this issue [3] and the python-rados RPM is installed [4]. 

Is the only change here that this new version of ceph-ansible is not installing this package?

- scenario001-multinode-oooq-container failed because the cinder test failed
- the cinder test failed because it's missing the python-rados package
- the older ceph-ansible installed it, but it's not necessary in a containerized overcloud [2]
- (install_centos_packages in ceph-ansible is not executed in ceph-docker-common)
- this hasn't been seen before because libs where shared; e.g. the ceph install provided it
- since cinder requires this package, perhpas it should have an explicit dependency

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/87/501987/3/check/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-multinode-oooq-container/da44172/logs/subnode-2/var/log/cinder/volume.log.txt.gz#_2017-09-21_02_16_00_650

commit_message:
feat: Add skyline-console to submodule

When building a docker image, skyline-console is required,
so add skyline-console as a git submodule.

Change-Id: I429879dbfb93f48aacbe09966388f25a5afab43d

commit_message:
Remove grenade jobs from old stable branches

As discussed and approved during the ironic wallaby midcycle, the grenade
jobs in old stable branches, starting from EM branches and up the oldest
not-EM (currently ussuri) are removed.

Change-Id: I61fc181cb488e913f828efa18dc010348986380d

subject: add enable/disable option for OVN-DVR
messages:
[{'account_id': 28752, 'date': '2021-04-05 15:25:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-04-05 15:45:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We shouldn't add a varaible when we can use just override, unless we need to change default behaviour or we need to do smth conditionally.

In this case I see no need in patch, except documenting how/where users can set variable."}, {'account_id': 13095, 'date': '2021-06-28 15:28:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

also for ovn the ""dvr"" stuff is managed via IIRC:

https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_neutron/blob/master/tasks/providers/setup_ovs_ovn.yml#L23-L27

I'm not sure it's really needed in the neutron configuration.'}, {'account_id': 28752, 'date': '2021-07-21 13:35:31.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

We don't need this patch because we can use Override variables."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-05 15:25:43.000000000', 'message': "add enable/disable option for OVN-DVR

By default L3 router scheduled for centralized snat/dnat routing,
in active-standby fashion but  'neutron_enable_distributed_floating_ip'
option will allow you to configure distributed virtual router (DVR).

Change-Id: Ieaf52b2caf57991fd9d0e58f89a2774b9a4d069b
"}]
commit_message:
add enable/disable option for OVN-DVR

By default L3 router scheduled for centralized snat/dnat routing,
in active-standby fashion but  'neutron_enable_distributed_floating_ip'
option will allow you to configure distributed virtual router (DVR).

Change-Id: Ieaf52b2caf57991fd9d0e58f89a2774b9a4d069b

commit_message:
sriov_config: light refactoring

merging cleaning up the numvfs getter/setters, converting pyformat
strings to f-strings and adding a bit more logging.

Change-Id: I3bf1ace914ab8a64f9165c72ffd06d389fad25b0
(cherry picked from commit 380254e897990dce4caea70b82118828e9a4789f)

[{'created': '2021-07-16 08:29:01.000000000', 'message': 'Adopt PEP-517 for packaging

- use setuptools-scm instead of pbr for packaging as this is PEP-517
  compliant
- dropping pbr enables us to make use of symlinks for building and
  ansible collection (pbr does not support symlinked modules).

Change-Id: I134ef8ac4c31b98dc25d17ab058af1ed34e27f32

commit_message:
Combine new modules into a single package

- Make newly added get_hash and yum_config modules part of
  triple_repos package.
- add simple packaging testing environment, which should validate
  installation of the command line
- moves tests/docs/examples in official location required by
  ansible-test
- includes required fix for looking up for local config.yaml

Change-Id: I134ef8ac4c31b98dc25d17ab058af1ed34e27f32

commit_message:
Bump os-resource-classes requirements

os-resource-classes 1.1.0 was recently released and upper
constraints were bumped. This brings 3 new standard resource classes so
the tests are adjusted.

blueprint: qos-minimum-guaranteed-packet-rate
Change-Id: I6d1c84ddc4094635bebe001ea046cd01f1c98bbb

subject: bifrost-cli: fix relative paths in --extra-vars
messages: [{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2021-07-21 09:19:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-07-21 09:39:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-21 09:19:27.000000000', 'message': 'bifrost-cli: fix relative paths in --extra-vars

Ansible accepts YAML files via the syntax `-e @path.yaml`. Since
bifrost-cli changes the working directory to "playbooks", relative paths
don't work as expected. Fix that by turning them into global paths.

Change-Id: I02ba2ac85c72362dbc424037c3d23231098e065b
(cherry picked from commit f0f6e6aa9e725bb3b6e0db6e78a223061385c1d6)
'}]
commit_message:
bifrost-cli: fix relative paths in --extra-vars

Ansible accepts YAML files via the syntax `-e @path.yaml`. Since
bifrost-cli changes the working directory to "playbooks", relative paths
don't work as expected. Fix that by turning them into global paths.

Change-Id: I02ba2ac85c72362dbc424037c3d23231098e065b
(cherry picked from commit f0f6e6aa9e725bb3b6e0db6e78a223061385c1d6)

commit_message:
Allow HTTP headers to be customised for IPA image download

This is useful if you need to specify a token when downloading
the image.

bifrost-cli: fix relative paths in --extra-vars

Ansible accepts YAML files via the syntax `-e @path.yaml`. Since
bifrost-cli changes the working directory to "playbooks", relative paths

commit_message:
Adding msg parameter in sove-converter script

msg parameter was missing from the converter script. 
Also changed the validation logic a bit because the 'msg' s and not 'id's are captured in sova log.

Change-Id: I5d0f36df7307e11f5aaf37ecb64e73cf01c6a7c9

commit_message:
Perform upgrade by default when installing ansible

We don't upgrade ansible in the upgrade jobs because the requirement is
already satisfied according to pip.
Although, we should upgrade ansible as it may differ between releases.
Also perform a clean install if ansible is already present to avoid
conflicts.

Change-Id: I3cb1059408ef069001cde91474c68768315ff784

commit_message:
Clear shared-db.setup when departing shared-db

When shared-db is rejoined the charm will reconfigure the DB IFF DB
related flags are cleared.

Change-Id: Ieb575d6aa220f10c519425f1e1a6f59e29c512f1
Closes-Bug: #1887265

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-19 17:32:52.000000000', 'message': 'Set glance limit for baremetal friendly images

The devstack default limit enforcement for glance defaults
to 1GB, and unfortunately this is too small for many to use
larger images such as centos which includes hardware firmware
images for execution on baremetal where drivers need the vendor
blobs in order to load/run.

Sets ironic-base to 5GB, and updates examples accordingly.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/801309
Change-Id: I41294eb571d07a270a69e5b816cdbad530749a94
'}]
commit_message:
Set glance limit for baremetal friendly images

The devstack default limit enforcement for glance defaults
to 1GB, and unfortunately this is too small for many to use
larger images such as centos which includes hardware firmware
images for execution on baremetal where drivers need the vendor
blobs in order to load/run.

Sets ironic-base to 5GB, and updates examples accordingly.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/801309
Change-Id: I41294eb571d07a270a69e5b816cdbad530749a94

[{'created': '2021-06-09 08:34:58.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for keystone_authtoken/memcache_use_advanced_pool

This change introduces a single parameter, MemcacheUseAdvancedPool,
to enable usage of advanced connection pool in keystone middleware.
This is useful to avoid bursting connection to memcached.

Note that the default value of memcached_use_advanced_pool was changed
from false to true during Xena cycle[1], so this parameter is no longer
required in master. However the change in keystonemiddleware will
never be backported. This change is created so that we can switch to
advanced pool even in older releases.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/keystonemiddleware/+/773939

commit_message:
Add support for keystone_authtoken/memcache_use_advanced_pool

This change introduces a single parameter, MemcacheUseAdvancedPool,
to enable usage of advanced connection pool in keystone middleware.
This is useful to avoid bursting connection to memcached.

Note that the default value of memcached_use_advanced_pool was changed
from false to true during Xena cycle[1], so this parameter is no longer
required in master. However the change in keystonemiddleware will
never be backported. This change is created so that we can switch to
advanced pool even in older releases.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/keystonemiddleware/+/773939

(To Victoria)
Conflicts:
	deployment/aodh/aodh-api-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/glance/glance-api-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/gnocchi/gnocchi-api-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/manila/manila-api-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/nova/nova-api-container-puppet.yaml

(To Train)
Conflicts:
	deployment/aodh/aodh-base.yaml
	deployment/barbican/barbican-api-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/cinder/cinder-api-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/experimental/designate/designate-api-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/glance/glance-api-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/gnocchi/gnocchi-api-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/heat/heat-base-puppet.yaml
	deployment/ironic/ironic-api-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/manila/manila-api-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/mistral/mistral-base.yaml
	deployment/neutron/neutron-api-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/nova/nova-api-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/nova/nova-metadata-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/nova/novajoin-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/octavia/octavia-api-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/placement/placement-api-container-puppet.yaml
	deployment/zaqar/zaqar-container-puppet.yaml

Also fixed Panko which is no longer supported since Ussuri.

Closes-Bug: #1931047
Change-Id: I2887249af44ccfdae1592dd9120d3366fa059876
(cherry picked from commit 09bcacd25a7217ce66eec10ccfda4847e6d3d87a)
(cherry picked from commit 9a89b9add62d1d6251285a091e96e98f8157d1bd)
(cherry picked from commit 89fde273eaf69bc32d79221883c7abf657ebbda9)
(cherry picked from commit bef9856ab1fcc7bf6e358f03c775a86705b3b985)

commit_message:
Add OS version to check reboot happened

In some cases OS of VM shuts down very slowly. After post_reboot_delay
(120 sec) ansible logs in to VM and runs "systemctl
is-system-running | grep -qE "running|degraded" which works perfectly on
RHEL/CentOS 7/8. Ansible will be puzzled as it doesn't detect any other
statuses. This issue was solved in ansible 2.10 by redesigning reboot
module where "boot_time_command" verifies boot_id before and after
reboot. However, we cannot backport ansible 2.10 to product so this
patch adds a little check to detect OS version to keep it simple. This
works as leapp installs RHEL8 in disconnected mode after reboot, ansible
won't be able to connect until leapp is done.

Resolves: rhbz#1980542

Change-Id: I6190ee794dce461077b08b486aef18cbf9cc04b3
(cherry picked from commit 2b33594c1958107b8170d20be5f17f74093fee62)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-30 02:32:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unplugging VIF when migrate/resize VM

When migrating/resizing VM to destination
host that has VIF type difference from source VIF
type, it fails due to exception in unplugging
VIF on source host after user perform a confirmation
action.

This change unplugs the vifs in resize_instance and
wraps the call to unplug in confirm with an try except
block. the call to unplug_vifs in confirm is not removed
to support rolling upgrades but a todo is added to remove
it after the Wallaby release.

Change-Id: I2c195df5fcf844c0587933b5b5995bdca1a3ebed
Closes-Bug: #1895220
(cherry picked from commit 66c7f00e1d9d7c0eebe46eb4b24b2b21f7413789)
'}, {'created': '2020-12-02 23:09:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unplugging VIF when migrate/resize VM

When migrating/resizing VM to destination
host that has VIF type difference from source VIF
type, it fails due to exception in unplugging
VIF on source host after user perform a confirmation
action.

This change unplugs the vifs in resize_instance and
wraps the call to unplug in confirm with an try except
block. the call to unplug_vifs in confirm is not removed
to support rolling upgrades but a todo is added to remove
it after the Wallaby release.

Change-Id: I2c195df5fcf844c0587933b5b5995bdca1a3ebed
Closes-Bug: #1895220
(cherry picked from commit 66c7f00e1d9d7c0eebe46eb4b24b2b21f7413789)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unplugging VIF when migrate/resize VM

When migrating/resizing VM to destination
host that has VIF type difference from source VIF
type, it fails due to exception in unplugging
VIF on source host after user perform a confirmation
action.

This change unplugs the vifs in resize_instance and
wraps the call to unplug in confirm with an try except
block. the call to unplug_vifs in confirm is not removed
to support rolling upgrades but a todo is added to remove
it after the Wallaby release.

Change-Id: I2c195df5fcf844c0587933b5b5995bdca1a3ebed
Closes-Bug: #1895220
(cherry picked from commit 66c7f00e1d9d7c0eebe46eb4b24b2b21f7413789)

commit_message:
docs: Update Freenode to OFTC

The OpenDev IRC services has switch from Freenode to OFTC
network [1].

This patch updates document with OFTC network details.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-May/022718.html

Change-Id: Ib8cfc913d5f29b945243a3580cd286fc0f06aee1

commit_message:
Replace deprecated import of ABCs from collections

ABCs in collections should be imported from collections.abc and direct
import from collections is deprecated since Python 3.3.

Change-Id: Ibca1d5756d7598e961e21c5ba9bd6e17bb895285
(cherry picked from commit 419e384ebbfa378d2a85f8fce5e066e6d5781188)

commit_message:
Replace deprecated inspect.getargspec

inspect.getargspec was deprecated since Python 3.0 and
inspect.getfullargspec is its replacement with correct handling of
function annotations and keyword-only parameters[1].

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/inspect.html#inspect.getargspec

Change-Id: Id91cd6dd61a0c1513e9c1bfa5672a156339f1d98

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-19 13:28:09.000000000', 'message': 'Possibility to set SSLCARevocationPath for keystone as chef default attribute "ca_revocation_path"

Also set SSLCARevocationCheck alongside SSLCARevocationPath, all one
gets by setting only the latter is warnings in Apache logs.

Note: with Apache 2.3.15 or newer enabling revocation checks causes
certificate validation to fail also when no CRLs for the given certificate
could be found. For details see
https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_ssl.html#sslcarevocationcheck

Co-authored-by: Marek Szuba <m.szuba@gsi.de>
Signed-off-by: Marek Szuba <m.szuba@gsi.de>
Change-Id: Ic64249ba32d43877f9ef0325e7156e0d15622a69
'}, {'created': '2021-07-20 12:26:38.000000000', 'message': 'Possibility to set SSLCARevocationPath for keystone as chef default attribute "ca_revocation_path"

Also set SSLCARevocationCheck alongside SSLCARevocationPath, all one
gets by setting only the latter is warnings in Apache logs.

Note: with Apache 2.3.15 or newer enabling revocation checks causes
certificate validation to fail also when no CRLs for the given certificate
could be found. For details see
https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_ssl.html#sslcarevocationcheck

Co-authored-by: Marek Szuba <m.szuba@gsi.de>
Signed-off-by: Marek Szuba <m.szuba@gsi.de>
Change-Id: Ic64249ba32d43877f9ef0325e7156e0d15622a69
'}]
commit_message:
Possibility to set SSLCARevocationPath for keystone as chef default attribute "ca_revocation_path"

Also set SSLCARevocationCheck alongside SSLCARevocationPath, all one
gets by setting only the latter is warnings in Apache logs.

Note: with Apache 2.3.15 or newer enabling revocation checks causes
certificate validation to fail also when no CRLs for the given certificate
could be found. For details see
https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_ssl.html#sslcarevocationcheck

Co-authored-by: Marek Szuba <m.szuba@gsi.de>
Signed-off-by: Marek Szuba <m.szuba@gsi.de>
Change-Id: Ic64249ba32d43877f9ef0325e7156e0d15622a69

commit_message:
Use explicit select condition in SQL query in "_port_filter_hook"

Instead of executing a subquery inside a select, use a proper filter
condition instead.

Closes-Bug: #1936675
Change-Id: I97e9ca244c0716510fcd4ec81d54046be9c5f8f8

commit_message:
Move mech driver VNIC validation to SimpleAgentMechanismDriverBase

The mechanism driver support VNIC types validation is done now in the
"SimpleAgentMechanismDriverBase" class __init__ method. If a subclass
needs to administratively prohibit any VNIC type supported by default,
"vnic_type_prohibit_list" must be passed to the base class __init__
call.

Related-Bug: #1578989

Change-Id: Ic25a8a7c716b4980ad2542b44519f77c6fdad309

[{'created': '2021-02-19 19:39:14.000000000', 'message': '[WIP][OVN] Add a SB Chassis event to track changes in BW config

Added a SB Chassis event to track any change in the resource provider
bandwidths or the inventory defaults.

TODO: complete the OVN client Placement API extension
TODO: finish the chassis event implementation
TODO: use the placement API to communicate this info

Partial-Bug: #1578989

Change-Id: I8ba38b8ace8852009fba8712aafa9f88c2b93ccb

'}, {'created': '2021-03-02 11:49:07.000000000', 'message': '[OVN][Placement] Add a SB Chassis event to track changes in BW config

Added a new OVN Client extension: OVNClientPlacementExtension. This
extension is in charge of handling the bandwidth information stored
in the OVN database, in the "Chassis" registers on the
"ovn-cms-options" dictionary.

Three new keys are created to store the resource provider information
needed to parameterize the network backend bandwidth information,
following the implementation done in OVS and SR-IOV:
- resource_provider_bandwidths
- resource_provider_inventory_defaults
- resource_provider_hypervisors

When the OVN Client is started, the Placement extension will check if
the "placement" extension is loaded. It will also create an event to
check any configuration change done in any "Chassis" register.

The Placement extension will read the initial configuration stored
in the OVN database and will populate it to Placement API, creating
the needed resource providers, traits and inventories.

NOTE: This patch belongs to a series of patches to implement
minimum bandwidth scheduling blueprint in OVN backend. The next
patch will make OVN backend scheduling aware using the information
stored in Placement API and the port information passed by Nova when
a VM is created.

Partial-Bug: #1578989

Change-Id: I8ba38b8ace8852009fba8712aafa9f88c2b93ccb

'}, {'created': '2021-03-20 15:39:56.000000000', 'message': '[OVN][Placement] Add a SB Chassis event to track changes in BW config

Added a new OVN Client extension: OVNClientPlacementExtension. This
extension is in charge of handling the bandwidth information stored
in the OVN database, in the "Chassis" registers on the
"ovn-cms-options" dictionary.

Three new keys are created to store the resource provider information
needed to parameterize the network backend bandwidth information,
following the implementation done in OVS and SR-IOV:
- resource_provider_bandwidths
- resource_provider_inventory_defaults
- resource_provider_hypervisors

When the OVN Client is started, the Placement extension will check if
the "placement" extension is loaded. It will also create an event to
check any configuration change done in any "Chassis" register.

The Placement extension will read the initial configuration stored
in the OVN database and will populate it to Placement API, creating
the needed resource providers, traits and inventories.

NOTE: This patch belongs to a series of patches to implement
minimum bandwidth scheduling blueprint in OVN backend. The next
patch will make OVN backend scheduling aware using the information
stored in Placement API and the port information passed by Nova when
a VM is created.

commit_message:
[OVN][Placement] Add a SB Chassis event to track changes in BW config

Added a new OVN Client extension: OVNClientPlacementExtension. This
extension is in charge of handling the bandwidth information stored
in the OVN database, in the "Chassis" registers on the
"ovn-cms-options" dictionary.

Three new keys are created to store the resource provider information
needed to parameterize the network backend bandwidth information,
following the implementation done in OVS and SR-IOV:
- resource_provider_bandwidths
- resource_provider_inventory_defaults
- resource_provider_hypervisors

When the OVN Client is started, the Placement extension will check if
the "placement" extension is loaded. It will also create an event to
check any configuration change done in any "Chassis" register.

The Placement extension will read the initial configuration stored
in the OVN database and will populate it to Placement API, creating
the needed resource providers, traits and inventories.

NOTE: This patch belongs to a series of patches to implement
minimum bandwidth scheduling blueprint in OVN backend. The next
patch will make OVN backend scheduling aware using the information
stored in Placement API and the port information passed by Nova when
a VM is created.

Partial-Bug: #1578989

Change-Id: I8ba38b8ace8852009fba8712aafa9f88c2b93ccb

commit_message:
Use absolute path for uwsgi_params include

Nginx config verification that is performed by ansible [1] is made
in tmp "on fly" which fails because of the relative import.

We also move task that replaces ports for nginx.conf to the end
so that config validation was accomplished after all configurations
are applied.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone/src/branch/master/tasks/keystone_nginx.yml#L44

Change-Id: Ic52fc7dbdb0324ab8f4b71d25398f23a05df05d7
(cherry picked from commit e377209297dd359c2191c8b1c23eae2ca21fe5eb)
(cherry picked from commit ad079a5bade97424b69849ce675743f8440a518b)

commit_message:
Use 'all' for ANSIBLE_VARS_PLUGIN_STAGE

ANSIBLE_VARS_PLUGIN_STAGE=inventory doesn't work with implicit
localhost in Ansible 2.11, use 'all' instead.
See https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/72590

Change-Id: Idc9e36563854b7e6590f74f14774d506c5dbc4c3

commit_message:
Allow for cron programming of backups

Normally, backups are not done interactively, but during nights or
weekends. This patch introduces the capacity of introducing in an easy
way cron programming that will execute backups in predictable intervals.

Closes-Bug: #1935675

Change-Id: I86b3fb2c3d846bcd56859e0d572f1fe4d5e148fa

subject: Remove the usage of ansible_date_time
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios@redhat.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22954, 'name': 'Juan Badia Payno', 'email': 'jbadiapa@redhat.com', 'username': 'jbadiapa'}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24245, 'name': 'Harald Jens친s', 'email': 'hjensas@redhat.com', 'username': 'harald.jensas'}, {'_account_id': 32728, 'name': 'Juan Pablo Lopez', 'email': 'jlopezgu@redhat.com', 'username': 'jplopezgu'}]

[{'account_id': 32968, 'date': '2021-07-15 12:30:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-07-15 13:15:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 32968, 'date': '2021-07-15 13:44:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 32968, 'date': '2021-07-15 13:47:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Alex,

this role is mainly intended to be used from openstack CLI, if there is a purposeful removal of inject_facts_as_vars, along with the default "smart" default gathering_policy and replace it with "implicit", it would be better IMHO to return to the original proposed way of obtaining the date, wich relied on the "date" OS command.

I have changed the git description to reflect this and patch set 2 implements the necessary changes.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-07-15 13:50:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

openstack cli inherits our ansible execution defaults. in which we remove inject_facts_as_vars which is why ansible_facts should be used instead of magic ansible_* vars.  We gather only minimal facts !all,min. I'd assume date_time is part of that but I'm not aware.  If you need a specific fact that isn't capture, you should use gather_subset to collect it."}, {'account_id': 32968, 'date': '2021-07-15 15:47:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks for the explanation.

Fortunately, date_time is included in that very minimal facts and ansible_facts.date_time works in this case, but it is only refreshed from time to time due to the "smart" gathering_policy used while running the playbook.

Of course, it is entirely possible to invoke the playbook using the "idempotent" gathering_policy, which will gather facts before each execution. However, as we can retrieve the date from the OS command, wouldn`t it be better to do this instead of slowing the whole execution of the playbook due to gather facts just to retrieve a date?'}, {'account_id': 32968, 'date': '2021-07-15 15:48:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sorry, by "idempotent", I meant "implicit" gathering_policy.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-07-15 15:48:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ah you're hitting fact caching. I'd just run a date command. This isn't part of the deployment (right?) so the impact shouldn't be that much"}, {'account_id': 32968, 'date': '2021-07-15 15:53:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It is not really fact caching, as it is set by default to 45 seconds (I hit this limit when using implicit), but with the smart policy I receive the same date_time at least for 10 minutes. After 1 hour, however, the date_time was succesfully updated.

However, I am happy to agree on the date command, and patch set 2 already reflects this. The impact for the patch is none, it is just a way to name backup files created by the backup process, they only need to be always different.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-07-16 06:33:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(3 comments)

makes sense'}, {'account_id': 32968, 'date': '2021-07-16 08:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 22954, 'date': '2021-07-16 09:09:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-07-16 13:32:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2021-07-20 13:45:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-15 12:30:12.000000000', 'message': 'Add an alternative to ansible_date_time when it is undefined

When the openstack CLI executes the playbooks, it does not populate the
traditional ansible facts, so that ansible_date_time is undefined.

This change populates the ansible_date_time variable if it is undefined
so it can be used to differentiate the backups that are being done in
different moments.

Change-Id: Ia0898c022604040a87b027f35a5878086ff80b50
'}, {'created': '2021-07-15 13:44:15.000000000', 'message': 'Remove the usage of ansible_date_time

As this playbook is mainly intended to be used from the openstack CLI,
whose ansible runner has purposely disabled inject_facts_as_vars[1],
along with the default usage of the "smart" gathering_policy that does
not updates the facts on every run (which destroys the purpose of
attaching timestamps to files to get keep different files from different
runs), it seems better to re-introduce the previous way of implementing
dynamic (timestamped based) names[2]

This way uses the "date" OS command to obtain always a different
timestamp without mandating a new gather_facts every execution nor
having to use facts not injected as vars.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/800934/1/tripleo_ansible/roles/backup_and_restore/tasks/run_backup.yml#37
[2]
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/795330/3/tripleo_ansible/roles/backup_and_restore/tasks/run_backup.yml#43

Change-Id: Ia0898c022604040a87b027f35a5878086ff80b50
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the usage of ansible_date_time

As this playbook is mainly intended to be used from the openstack CLI,
whose ansible runner has purposely disabled inject_facts_as_vars[1],
along with the default usage of the "smart" gathering_policy that does
not updates the facts on every run (which destroys the purpose of
attaching timestamps to files to get keep different files from different
runs), it seems better to re-introduce the previous way of implementing
dynamic (timestamped based) names[2]

This way uses the "date" OS command to obtain always a different
timestamp without mandating a new gather_facts every execution nor
having to use facts not injected as vars.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/800934/1/tripleo_ansible/roles/backup_and_restore/tasks/run_backup.yml#37
[2]
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/795330/3/tripleo_ansible/roles/backup_and_restore/tasks/run_backup.yml#43

Change-Id: Ia0898c022604040a87b027f35a5878086ff80b50

commit_message:
Force ansible-lint to check just this repository

Doing tox -e linterns on the undercloud gives the followig error:

Ansible-lint...............................................Failed
- hook id: ansible-lint
- exit code: 2
INFO     Executing syntax check on tripleo_ansible/playbooks/\
cli-baremetal-clean.yaml (0.77s)
WARNING  Listing 1 violation(s) that are fatal
../../../usr/share/ansible/roles/openstack-operations/tasks/\
restart_service.yml:1:3: syntax-check couldn't resolve module/action \
'service_map_facts'. This often indicates a misspelling, missing \
collection, or incorrect module path.
You can skip specific rules or tags by adding them to your \
configuration file:
warn_list:  # or 'skip_list' to silence them completely
  - syntax-check  # Ansible syntax check failed

Finished with 1 failure(s), 0 warning(s) on 1382 files.

This patch fixes this.

Closes-Bug: #1917938
Change-Id: Icf626c77db879f6654ed2c34004b8b67e23258ef
(cherry picked from commit cb2e3fb290c85079c06a6901692af52fc85d06d1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-07-07 14:19:30.000000000', 'message': 'Move the snapshots feature to optional/beta

Previously a commit[1] introduced a new way of doing backup, using
"snapshots", that do not require to bring down the whole controller to
take the backup. On that commit, the old way was removed, which do not
follow the deprecation procedure.

This commits reintroduces the old way of performing backups via stopping
the controllers and move the snapshots feature to an optional,
user-selected feature.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/786380

(cherry picked from commit 00a17ffb4a2262bffe750330bee333a8d3948247)
Change-Id: I49944d585825b32052278cd865a74c46dcb5eaa4
(cherry picked from commit 2b56b7f933adda7bd26c8ccf12bee179beb1dffb)
(cherry picked from commit 091dd3fbb9385c65552db8f44e779544d617a18d)

Previously a commit[1] introduced a new way of doing backup, using
"snapshots", that do not require to bring down the whole controller to
take the backup. On that commit, the old way was removed, which do not
follow the deprecation procedure.

the controllers and move the snapshots feature to an optional,
user-selected feature.

This was not a clean cherry-pick due to different role names

commit_message:
Move the snapshots feature to optional/beta

Previously a commit[1] introduced a new way of doing backup, using
"snapshots", that do not require to bring down the whole controller to
take the backup. On that commit, the old way was removed, which do not
follow the deprecation procedure.

This commits reintroduces the old way of performing backups via stopping
the controllers and move the snapshots feature to an optional,
user-selected feature.

This was not a clean cherry-pick due to different role names
(backup_and_restore vs backup-and-restore) so manual merge has been
done.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/786380

(cherry picked from commit 00a17ffb4a2262bffe750330bee333a8d3948247)
Change-Id: I49944d585825b32052278cd865a74c46dcb5eaa4
(cherry picked from commit 2b56b7f933adda7bd26c8ccf12bee179beb1dffb)
(cherry picked from commit 091dd3fbb9385c65552db8f44e779544d617a18d)

commit_message:
Require placmenet::api in wsgi+apache deployment

This change drops the redundant implementation left to keep backword
compatibility during refactoring of placement::api[1] during V-cycle.

[1] 425180f5b8789852cba3511e16218fcb9c4607e2

Change-Id: I3e989c3c7b37741904dcb51b0f950ced33d11a2b

commit_message:
TripleO: Reduce tempest test scope

This change reduces scope of tempest tests in tripleo job, so that we
run only subset of test cases used in TripleO repos.

commit_message:
Enable policy settings in placement-api

This change makes placement::policy included by the api class
automatically to enable oslo.policy settings automatically in
the placement service.

Closes-Bug: #1935761
Change-Id: I75f518c9f9a23237e59c2452462d261517df5e64
(cherry picked from commit 5850aba4a81d507329ff2049dfee4fa610328cca)

commit_message:

run only subset of test cases used in TripleO repos.

commit_message:
Updates to federation documentation

- Standardise use of default as domain id for federated identities
that is necessary for newer ansible collections.

- Add information about OIDC with mod_auth_openidc.

- General updates to SAML / older documentation.

Change-Id: Ife7176bf5b9b7e52ceec6ef8971349222477414e

commit_message:
Fix instance table behavior after deleting an instance

After deleting a VM from the instances table,
all VMs above it in the table list disappear from the
UI until the page is refreshed.

Partial-Bug: #1859851

Change-Id: Icae04fd0f0c3f3fa5127309b64fc1b15e3bbc677

commit_message:
Remove puppet-kmod

Kernel modules are now managed by tripleo-ansible, so this module is
no longer used[1].

[1] 8e10ee78c8fcb037cfc03d58b4584dfe7ccc45ca

Change-Id: Ic2f6b0dfd3bead5d4037e33f31a0533de17d4501

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-05 15:31:06.000000000', 'message': "policy: Copy rules before providing them to enforcer

There's currently a small bug in 'oslo.policy' that results in the rules
we provide to an enforcer being modified, with those changes being
persisted over subsequent enforcer invocations. This isn't an issue at
run time but is in test environments where we create a new enforcer with
each test but use the same rule objects since the test process is the
same.

While the fix is ultimately in 'oslo.policy', this small tweak avoids
the need to blacklist the borked release.

Change-Id: Idc8b6bf565e10864b7e3d4f5395942250de7942d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
policy: Copy rules before providing them to enforcer

There's currently a small bug in 'oslo.policy' that results in the rules
we provide to an enforcer being modified, with those changes being
persisted over subsequent enforcer invocations. This isn't an issue at
run time but is in test environments where we create a new enforcer with
each test but use the same rule objects since the test process is the
same.

While the fix is ultimately in 'oslo.policy', this small tweak avoids
the need to blacklist the borked release.

Change-Id: Idc8b6bf565e10864b7e3d4f5395942250de7942d
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-26 01:49:20.000000000', 'message': "Fix creating encrypted volume from image

When creating an encrypted volume from an image, the flow is
something like:

qemu-img create <encrypted file>
qemu-img convert <image> <encrypted file>
rbd import <encrypted file>

but, the create specifies a size based on the volume size, i.e.
1024MB for a 1GB volume.

Then the convert from raw to LUKS assumes that a 1024MB image
being converted into that file would fit into that encrypted file
-- but it doesn't fit because capacity is lost due to the LUKS
headers.  qemu-img convert here truncates data but doesn't fail
when doing so.

rbd import then succeeds and the end of the image/volume is
missing when the volume is attached.

This fix attempts to pre-create dest file with a slightly larger
size before the conversion happens.

Change-Id: I029a20561c0ef4558595bb0240a26130580464a2
"}, {'created': '2021-03-26 13:15:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix creating encrypted volume from image

When creating an encrypted volume from an image, the flow is
something like:

qemu-img create <encrypted file>
qemu-img convert <image> <encrypted file>
rbd import <encrypted file>

but, the create specifies a size based on the volume size, i.e.
1024MB for a 1GB volume.

Then the convert from raw to LUKS assumes that a 1024MB image
being converted into that file would fit into that encrypted file
-- but it doesn't fit because capacity is lost due to the LUKS
headers.  qemu-img convert here truncates data but doesn't fail
when doing so.

rbd import then succeeds and the end of the image/volume is
missing when the volume is attached.

This fix attempts to pre-create dest file with a slightly larger
size before the conversion happens.

Change-Id: I029a20561c0ef4558595bb0240a26130580464a2
"}, {'created': '2021-03-31 14:19:33.000000000', 'message': "Fix creating encrypted volume from unencrypt image

When creating an encrypted volume from an unencrypt
image the volume corrupts and it's inaccessible
after the operation. This happens because in order
to encrypt the destination volume we need a header.
Cinder doesn't show any problem and just truncates
the data to keep the image's size.

In order to solve this the destination size needs
to be slightly larger (to include the encryption
header ~5M) before the conversion happens.

Change-Id: I029a20561c0ef4558595bb0240a26130580464a2
"}, {'created': '2021-04-05 20:22:49.000000000', 'message': "Fix creating encrypted volume from unencrypt image

When creating an encrypted volume from an unencrypt
image the volume corrupts and it's inaccessible

Cinder doesn't show any problem and just truncates

In order to solve this the destination size needs
to be slightly larger (to include the encryption
header ~5M) before the conversion happens.

Closes-Bug: #1922586
Change-Id: I029a20561c0ef4558595bb0240a26130580464a2
"}, {'created': '2021-04-05 20:24:30.000000000', 'message': "Fix creating encrypted volume from unencrypt image

In order to solve this the destination size needs

Closes-Bug: #1922586
Change-Id: I029a20561c0ef4558595bb0240a26130580464a2
"}, {'created': '2021-04-06 22:04:55.000000000', 'message': "Fix creating encrypted volume from unencrypt image

When creating an encrypted volume from an unencrypt
image the volume corrupts and it's inaccessible
after the operation. This happens because in order
to encrypt the destination volume we need a header.
Cinder doesn't show any problem and just truncates
the data to keep the image's size.

In order to solve this the destination size needs
to be slightly larger (to include the encryption
header ~5M) before the conversion happens.

Closes-Bug: #1922586
Change-Id: I029a20561c0ef4558595bb0240a26130580464a2

commit_message:
Fix creating encrypted volume from unencrypt image

When creating an encrypted volume from an unencrypt
image the volume corrupts and it's inaccessible
after the operation. This happens because in order
to encrypt the destination volume we need a header.
Cinder doesn't show any problem and just truncates
the data to keep the image's size.

In order to solve this the destination size needs
to be slightly larger (to include the encryption
header ~5M) before the conversion happens.

Closes-Bug: #1922586
Change-Id: I029a20561c0ef4558595bb0240a26130580464a2

commit_message:
Add support for MultiStrOpt

This replaces the provider implementation of octavia_config type so
that MultiStrOpt, which is used by several options like
 - oslo_messaging_notifications/driver
 - oslo_policy/policy_dirs
are handled correctly.

Change-Id: Ic8da2858b4c512d31ebbf78a128367d152cf7616

commit_message:
octavia-controller: Convert list values for ListOpts

The following parameters in octavia-controller are defined as ListOpt
which accept comma-separated list.
This change ensures that the corresponding parameters in puppet-octavia
accepts list values and convert these values to strings in the proper
format.
 - controller_worker/amp_secgroup_list
 - controller_worker/amp_boot_network_list
 - health_manager/controller_ip_port_list
 - amphora_agent/admin_log_targets
 - amphora_agent/tenant_log_targets

Change-Id: I6564e94550ea66f18fd99780a4c990fd18b4da4d

commit_message:
Set "floatingip.fixed_port" as viewonly

Set "floatingip.fixed_port" attribute as
viewonly. According to [1], "the originating relationship for a
particular state change will not produce state changes within the
viewonly relationship". That means any change on any of those ports
won't change the backref and won't affect "floatingip" object.

Closes-Bug: #1930294

[1]https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/orm/relationship_api.html

Change-Id: I202a12f82f70b1094cdb986ba404f396d5e0e427
(cherry picked from commit a98fe51b83440693f8acf17b157c38a944ef65ef)

commit_message:
Add a privsep context only for link commands

This new context will have only two capabilities: CAP_NET_ADMIN
and CAP_SYS_ADMIN (for operations inside namespaces).

Change-Id: If9273db1a7ccdce3a81f68fce78408830e9c3d42

commit_message:
Fix wrong variable name in ceilometer.conf.j2 template.

ceilometer_rpc_ssl_ca_file was used instead of ceilometer_oslomsg_rpc_ssl_ca_file
in the RPC transport_url.

Change-Id: Iab9729ee65571a45b5e50bb6a593386b1e238944

commit_message:
Add conflict_handler parameter as attribut in Command class

Adding conflict_handler as attribut in the Command class in order to be
able to take control of this parameter and change to different behavior
that argparse is handling: error / resolve / ignore.

Callers will be able to override it and get a proper Parser object.

Change-Id: I327ece99a04bc8b2ebfa554dea643b1f2a456336

commit_message:
Allow overriding backend_host for all backends

A typical high-availability deployment has multiple controller nodes,
but only one cinder-volume service running. In such setup
the backend_host parameter is set to a common host name, otherwise
volumes can't be managed cinder-volume service is move to a different
controller node.

However currently this backend_host parameter is defined for each
individual backend. Thus users need to define the same backend_host
parameter in multiple sections if their deployment have multiple
volume backends. This requirement is very redundant.

This change adds the backend_host parameter to the backend_defaults
section, so that users can use this single parameter to define a common
hostname used among their controller cluster.

Change-Id: Iacd3786e6a990c837b2f5b6505d9f35018ebd3be

commit_message:
Set "floatingip.fixed_port" as viewonly

Set "floatingip.fixed_port" attribute as
viewonly. According to [1], "the originating relationship for a
particular state change will not produce state changes within the
viewonly relationship". That means any change on any of those ports
won't change the backref and won't affect "floatingip" object.

Closes-Bug: #1930294

[1]https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/14/orm/relationship_api.html

Change-Id: I202a12f82f70b1094cdb986ba404f396d5e0e427
(cherry picked from commit a98fe51b83440693f8acf17b157c38a944ef65ef)

commit_message:
Refactor out library/keystone_sp and updates to use collections

Simplify maintained codebase by getting rid of library/keystone_sp can
use looping instead now.
Updates to openstack collections in terms of naming, as well as using
newer implemented functionalities.

Change-Id: I2f02ca712f309285310693b191f0d1cd1be8e24d

commit_message:
Libvirt: quote config parameters in resource types

This change implements the quote parameter in libvirtd_config and
virtlogd_config, so that we can quote the value by that simple
parameter instead of implementing a logic in each manifests.

Also, with this change libvirtd_config and virtlogd_config supports
$::os_service_default, so that we can define absence of parameters more
easily.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/792735
Change-Id: I3030ca34088019be932a9cc33344f7fb473a9aea

commit_message:
Add enforce_scope setting support for Cinder

Conder started moving to new RBAC and cinder-tempest-plugin
and Tempest need to set few configuration to enable the
scope checks on cinder side and on Temepst side to tell
cinder is all configured with scope checks and test can be run with
scoped token.

Change-Id: Ic7cd919c000c4e7b9a3a06638a5bd87b1617e749

commit_message:
Reduce irrelevant-files from content provider jobs

Patches to code in tripleo-quickstart-extras that
trigger tripleo-ci-centos-8-undercloud-upgrade
jobs are failing as
tripleo-ci-centos-8-content-provider-wallaby
was not run.

tripleo-multinode-branchful template limits the
files where the branches content providers run.

This patch reduces the irrelevant files to avoid
the freeze graph error
Currently it's equal to upgrade job set.

Change-Id: I4ea37e56dae4a3bc2e95c510e39c7af561f50088

commit_message:
Replace deprecated import of ABCs from collections

ABCs in collections should be imported from collections.abc and direct
import from collections is deprecated since Python 3.3.

Closes-Bug: #1936667
Change-Id: I018963cbca6ce4c4e0045be0c78f9cd2aa942d45

[{'created': '2021-03-18 09:28:23.000000000', 'message': '[docker] Added a new flag to disable default network

Docker is using 172.17.0.0/16 by default for bridge networking on
docker0, and this might cause routing problems for operator networks.

This change introduces docker_disable_default_network to disable the
bridge networking by putting "bridge: none"[1] to daemon.json

Bridge networking does not work without iptables, so we set the default
for docker_disable_default_network to
docker_disable_default_iptables_rules.

For better defaults, this feature will be enabled by default in
Wallaby.

[1] https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/dockerd/

Change-Id: Ic745300b27e50132d80d03787fa4abfada2d0173
Closes-Bug: #1848249
Related-Bug: #1849275
(cherry picked from commit 4053a0afdb3d0a230557883453b89b06cf4d7057)

commit_message:
[docker] Added a new flag to disable default network

Docker is using 172.17.0.0/16 by default for bridge networking on
docker0, and this might cause routing problems for operator networks.

This change introduces docker_disable_default_network to disable the
bridge networking by putting "bridge: none"[1] to daemon.json

Bridge networking does not work without iptables, so we set the default
for docker_disable_default_network to
docker_disable_default_iptables_rules.

For better defaults, this feature will be enabled by default in
Wallaby.

[1] https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/dockerd/

Change-Id: Ic745300b27e50132d80d03787fa4abfada2d0173
Closes-Bug: #1848249
Related-Bug: #1849275
(cherry picked from commit 4053a0afdb3d0a230557883453b89b06cf4d7057)

commit_message:
tripleo-transfer: ability to customize files transfer options

There are use cases where it's useful to be able to explicitly
exclude files from a transfer request. For example when syncing galera
database, we don't want to copy coredumps, local galera state file...

Add the ability to explicitly include or exclude files by specifying
a list of files or wildcard-based patterns.

Also make the default transfer options configurable, to best suit
transfer use cases.

Related-Bug: #1925260

Conflicts:
	tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo-transfer/molecule/default/playbook.yml
	tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_transfer/molecule/default/converge.yml
	tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_transfer/molecule/default/molecule.yml
	tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_transfer/molecule/default/verify.yml

Removed the test part that was specific to Ussuri

Change-Id: I1e88907db0bb26d52c92cb996eb56767e06b3874
(cherry picked from commit 6f75fd172326b010e680fc0bdda8d880e256a58e)
(cherry picked from commit 23531b28c42f9e68bb82253dc52432f20fde8e1e)
(cherry picked from commit db0bf528a4a5a1e9ece0f0186cf14fba4d60d5b4)

'}, {'created': '2021-07-19 23:03:17.000000000', 'message': 'Use section-database for DB config template

The Barbican charm was using the old template for DB connection that was
missing the "[database]" heading. This lead to errors like:

1045, "Access denied for user 'barbican'@'10.254.4.59' (using password:
NO)")

The barbican-manage tool still requires the old sql_connection in the
"[DEFAULT]" header, so leave that in place.

Add the current section-database template which includes the
"[database]" header.

Change-Id: I84f3a9eab76308466da1d1fcde8a7915fcc28bfc
Closes-Bug: #1936467
'}]
commit_message:
Use section-database for DB config template

The Barbican charm was using the old template for DB connection that was
missing the "[database]" heading. This lead to errors like:

1045, "Access denied for user 'barbican'@'10.254.4.59' (using password:
NO)")

The barbican-manage tool still requires the old sql_connection in the
"[DEFAULT]" header, so leave that in place.

Add the current section-database template which includes the
"[database]" header.

Change-Id: I84f3a9eab76308466da1d1fcde8a7915fcc28bfc
Closes-Bug: #1936467

transfers the entire database between two nodes: in-place copy,
no delta-transfer, no compression, selective file copy.

Tested by running an FFU from Queens to Train on an composable
HA overcloud.

Change-Id: I557962e77d6558281603b40d0adf01b912e8c2f9
Closes-Bug: #1925260
(cherry picked from commit 5ef7f9330abb2b8d9fa981ef9a9a4824bf069ac7)

"}]
commit_message:
FFU: change transfer parameters for database resync

Configure tripleo_transfer's flags to mimick the way a galera SST
transfers the entire database between two nodes: in-place copy,
no delta-transfer, no compression, selective file copy.

Tested by running an FFU from Queens to Train on an composable
HA overcloud.

Change-Id: I557962e77d6558281603b40d0adf01b912e8c2f9
Closes-Bug: #1925260
(cherry picked from commit 5ef7f9330abb2b8d9fa981ef9a9a4824bf069ac7)
(cherry picked from commit f972c371008cd5e6b32b01d3710ea81e8dd72f2e)

commit_message:
barbican-client: enabling nova::compute::verify_glance_signatures

When configuring barbican-client service, it might be a good idea to
also enable nova::compute::verify_glance_signatures by default.

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/1983126
Change-Id: Iab8f49d5b53044e29a267466fe09801566400834

This is shaping very well, but I'd like a bit more details on crucial interactions for those of us who are not familiar how attestation works in general. Please see inline."}, {'account_id': 32454, 'date': '2020-12-03 16:34:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2020-12-03 17:12:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

> Patch Set 17: Code-Review-1
> 
> (4 comments)
> 
> This is shaping very well, but I'd like a bit more details on crucial interactions for those of us who are not familiar how attestation works in general. Please see inline.

++

I am feeling the same on this spec and stated in previous comments. Some people may have better understanding, but the interaction is not very clear in the spec.

Well, some background on attestation in general: it involves two parties, one is the agent side, which is running on the host with the hardware TPM, the other side is the server side, who is resposible to get TPM recorded system state from the agent side. Then the server compares the state from agent against a known good system state (previously collected, also called whitelist), then decide whether the target is in the expected state, further actions can be taken according to the result. The system state retrieved from agent is signed by TPM, thus can't be forged.

In case of keylime, the server side is composed of two services: keylime verifier and keylime registrar, the agent side is called keylime agent. When agent starts up, it has to interact with keylime registrar to finish the registration and activation, then there should be an external request to keylime verifier to add the agent to verifier with whitelist, and instruct verifier to get quote from the agent. There are other interaction between verifier, registrar and agent, which is a bit complex for now."}, {'account_id': 32454, 'date': '2020-12-04 16:53:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

This spec seems underspecified. I *think* the distilled goal is actually "if a node is unable to produce certain PCR values, the Ironic Conductor should do different state transitions".

The spec seems unclear on which specific transitions this affects.

It also seems mildly over-engineered to include at least Keylime "Verifier" and "Registrar"--state concepts like "Keylime agent" overlap with "Ironic node", which means this design needs to do extra work to synchronize "Keylime agent" and "Ironic node" state.

Why is "Keylime agent" state spread between the "Verifier" and "Registrar"? Why is this not one service at most?

A simpler design may just be to add much lighter-weight "measure PCR value" feature to IPA. This could exist as a deploy or clean step.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-03-01 14:35:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: Code-Review-1

Marking -1 pending revision discussed last week to provide insight into the flow since the mechanics had not been yet pinned down at the actual level of service interactions.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2021-03-01 14:36:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20: -Code-Review

removing +2 until further dicussion'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-03-22 15:30:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 20:

Noting discussion because otherwise I'm going to delete it from the ironic etherpad to clean up the etherpad.

Discussion 20210224 - Trying to clear up confusion regarding 
Concerns from the review jam over networking requirements/architecture and trying to work out the resulting mechanics.
This comes into question how to securely transport a secure allow list (A hash file (The approved measurements))
In theory, a bad entry in the allow list results in possible machine locking or continuing to run but failing attestation.
This is driven by the concenrs on how to handle it with edge networking.
keylime folks are concerned "is this even feasible to do"
* can the conductor send it
* can the conductor start this?
This seems to be a big architecture issue.
Modeled, at least right now on direct L2/L3 shared subnet access
Operators are expecting further away from the conductors (i.e. edge)
What is needed
-Extensive documentation on how the communation works
- extensive documentation on what information needs to be provided in terms of how to communicate with the VM.
Taking a step back from the underlying mechanics concerns
* as of yesterday, a flow had not been settled upon
They were having issues with trying to figure out a way to securely transport the allow list.
* conundrum is the process
1) Keylime agent (end machine) requires "allow list" to be sent upon registration of the
2) Once the  end-machine has registered and uploaded
3) The keylime agent defines it's own ID, that ID needs to be used by the ironic-conductor to validate if attestation passed or failed.
Currently defaults to hostname, or random id, which is not ideal since we have ironic users who are just using v6 without any hostnames. 
* Confusion exists on the overall process, it appears only three pieces of information are needed
- where to get the allow list from (see next line)
- where to get the checksum to verify the allow list (seems agreeable that this is like driver_info\keylime_allow_list and driver_info\keylime_allow_list_checksum 
- URL
Recommendation: Define single flow diagram to clarify the communiation requirements and process
Recommendation: Use the existing flow diagram style as in the ironic docs
Recommendation: Documentation will need to be cover communication requirements and specific services required.
Recommendation: identify a deterministic or value and how it will get back to ironic so it can independently inquire if attestation is good.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-03-22 17:17:42.000000000', 'content': 'Hashtag removed: ironic-week-prio'}, {'account_id': 32454, 'date': '2021-03-29 20:46:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 32454, 'date': '2021-03-29 21:05:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

commit_message:
Drop cinder v2 API support

Cinder v2 API is deprecated since pike release. Along with the removal
of cinder v2 API support in cinderclient (change I335db5c1799e drops
v2 support), this commit drops cinder v2 support in horizon.

The next release of python-cinderclient drops v2 support,
so horizon needs to use v3 classes.

Includes a workaround in unit tests for two cinderclient.v3 classes
that are missing in the cinderclient releases prior to 8.0.0.  The
workaround can be removed once cinderclient change I335db5c1799edb2
is merged and released.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Iab0f097fab6696462572dc6ea53767c91e5411b1

commit_message:
Remove v2 classes

Remove all cinderclient.v2 classes, mostly incorporating them into
their v3 counterparts and updating the tests and test fixtures.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/800814
